There were no significant roadway grade or, crown issues with the roadway surface, in the area preceding, at or, beyond the crash site.
At the location of the crash site there is a marked pedestrian crosswalk 12 feet in width bordered by painted solid white lines 12 inches wide. There are posted ?pedestrian crossing? signs for both directions of travel on the approach to the crosswalk.
The opposing lanes of traffic are separated by painted double solid yellow lane markers. Each lane is approximately 22 feet in width with an overall travel way of 44 feet. Both sides of the street are bordered by raised concrete curbing, 8 foot wide grass parkway and 5 foot wide pedestrian sidewalks. The area is largely residential single family homes however adjacent to the crash site are open public park lands.

MC1 was a 2008 Yamaha YZF R6 (sport race replica) motorcycle being operated by a 22 year old male rider. The rider was travelling northbound in the #1 lane following behind OV1.
OV1 was a 1998 Honda Civic (automobile) being operated by an unlicensed 29 year old male. OV1 was travelling northbound in the #1 lane approaching the marked crosswalk.
As the driver of OV1 was approaching the marked crosswalk he noticed someone crossing the street, inside the crosswalk. The driver slowed to a stop to yield to the pedestrian and as he did his vehicle was struck from behind by MC1. The driver of OV1 said he had been stopped for about three seconds before
the rear of his vehicle was struck by MC1. The resulting impact caused minor damage to MC1 and the rear bumper of OV1. The impact also caused the rider to drop his bike (right side down) onto the roadway surface.
 
The driver of OV1 got out of his vehicle to check on the rider and also make contact with the pedestrian to see if they had witnessed the crash event. It was at this time the rider of MC1 picked up his bike and drove off without providing any information to the driver of OV1. The driver of OV1 and occupants were not injured as a result of the crash. The pedestrian was not injured.
The rider of MC1 was located and detained by police. When contacted the rider displayed the objective symptoms of alcohol intoxication. He was subsequently arrested for driving under the influence and hit & run.
Other than what has been addressed in this summary, there were no other vehicles, pedestrians, animals or, environmental conditions that caused or contributed to the crash event.
RiderInj: The 22 year old male rider of MC1 sustained non-life threatening injuries as a result of the collision. The injuries were limited to an abrasion to the right knee. The police report indicated that he had initially fled the scene however when apprehended officers noted the presence of alcohol and/or drugs in the rider?s system and he was subsequently arrested. MCR BAC showed .10 during the investigation.
Human:
The 22 year old male rider of MC1 had been driving under the influence of an intoxicant. He had also been traveling at a speed that was unsafe for the present traffic on the roadway and, may have been following too close. The rider declined an interview regarding the research program.
The 29 year male driver of OV1 did not contribute anything to the cause or outcome of the crash event.
Vehicle:
During the inspection of MC1 there was evidence of minor damage (scraping etc.) to both side covers and evidence of scraping/grinding to both left and right engine guards however this was not commensurate with the lack of physical evidence found on the roadway surface. MC1 appeared to have been in satisfactory operating condition prior to the collision.
OV1 sustained minor damage to the rear bumper and appeared to have been in satisfactory operating condition prior to the crash event.
Environmental: There were no environmental factors that were determined to have contributed to the cause or outcome of this crash event.

CrashType: Motorcycle vs. Suv
MV1: 1982 Harley Davidson FLH Classic Soft-tail (1337cc) Cruiser style motorcycle
Crash:
This two-vehicle crash occurred on a Monday in August 2013, at 1958 hours in Southern California. It was daylight, the temperature was approximately 68 degrees F, and the winds were approximately 6.9 mph out of the SW. The asphalt roadway surface was dry, noted to be travel worn, and there was moderate traffic.

The crash occurred in a 4 leg intersection. The vehicles were traveling westbound on a busy, commercial East/West minor arterial road that curves to the left, has a 3.2% negative westbound grade, a 1.8% crown, and a speed limit of 45 mph. East of the intersection there are 3 through lanes, a right turn lane, and a left turn lane separated by a 7 ft. painted divider and the east/west lanes are separated by a 4 ft. wide double yellow painted median. On the west side of the intersection there are 3 through lanes, a bicycle lane, and the east/west lanes are separated by a 4 ft. wide raised concrete and brick divider. The North/South road played no part in this crash.
MC1 is a 1982 Harley Davidson FLH Classic Soft-tail (1337cc) Cruiser style motorcycle ridden by a 38 year old male (6 ft. 1 in. and 205 lbs.). The rider was reportedly wearing an unknown make/model helmet. OV1 is an Unknown white SUV (Hit & Run), driven by an unknown person.

MC1 was traveling west in the #1 lane approaching the intersection with a green signal. As MC1 entered the intersection traffic on the west side slowed dramatically. As the rider applied the rear brake to slow, OV1 which was westbound in the # 1 lane, behind MC1, struck MC1 in the right rear. This caused MC1 to rotate clockwise and go down on its left side. OV1 continued to push MC1 onto the center divider approximately 21 ft. 8 in. where MC1and the rider came to rest on their left side facing north partially on the center divider and in the #1 lane. OV1 fled the scene westbound.
RiderInj: The 38 year-old male rider of MC1 sustained the following injuries as related on the police report: head trauma Not Further Specified (NFS), a 6 in. laceration to left thigh NFS, and road rash on his back NFS . The Injury Severity Score (ISS) was 1. There was no drug or alcohol involvement on the part of the rider of MC1.
Human: The unknown driver of OV1 failed to slow or stop dragging MC1 approximately 52 ft. before disengaging and fleeing the scene.
Vehicle: There were no crash causation factors related to MC1.
Environmental: There were no environmental crash causation factors.

CrashType: Motorcycle (MC1) lost control in collision avoidance with OV1. MC1 went down on its right side plane and then impacted OV1 on the left side. MC1 had no passenger.
Crash:
This is a crash in which MC1 lost control while rear braking and high sided onto its right side plane and then slid into OV1 who was making a left turn at an intersection. OV1 was stopped at the time of the impact. MC1 was into a CCW yaw (approximately 55 degrees) before losing control. After impacting the paved roadway surface, MC1 went into a CW rotation and then impacted OV1 on the lower left side below the driver?s door. The crash occurred at a ?T? type, not skewed intersection that had no signal controls. The roadway is a minor arterial. It has two through lanes in each direction, with a constant two way left turn lane in the rider?s direction. The opposing direction has a dedicated left turn lane. The intersecting street is on the rider?s right and is controlled by a stop
sign. This roadway is a two lane road divided by double yellow lines. On the rider?s right, the area is commercial/retail. On the left is a high school. The roadway has an east/west dedication, but is in a southwest/northeast orientation at the crash site. The roadway is bordered by concrete curbs and 12? sidewalks. On-street parking is allowed. The roadway is straight and level with a -0.7% downgrade and a 2.0% crown. The posted speed limit is 40 mph. There are no permanent visual obstructions that would be considered contributory to the crash. The roadway is made of an asphalt composition, is worn and polished, but in otherwise good condition. Pre-impact tire marks were visible from MC1. Following the tire mark from MC1 were some scrapes and gouges
leading to its FRP. The crash occurred in Southern California in August of 2013 at 1334 hrs. The weather was clear with a temperature of 81 degrees F. The wind was moderate from the SSW. Traffic conditions were light to moderate. The rider was not ejected and sustained minor injuries.

MC1 was 2003 Kawasaki ZX 6R sport/racing type motorcycle that was being operated by a 49 year old female (5? 04?/165 lbs.). The rider said that she was on her way to a relative?s home from her home. She was wearing a full face Shoei helmet with integral chin bar and a gray/smoke face shield. The helmet had labeling for FMVSS 218 (DOT) and Snell M2000 safety ratings.

MC1 was westbound in the #1 lane at a stated speed of 35 mph, which is below the posted speed limit of 40 mph. She said that she was leading a pack of
 
vehicles and that there was one vehicle near her in the #2 lane. The rider stated that she saw OV1 stopped at the stop sign for the cross street as she approached the intersection. As the rider neared the intersection, OV1 slowly pulled out into the street attempting to make a left turn. The rider stated that she saw the female driver (5?03?/130 lbs.) of OV1 was looking to her right, and never saw her look to the left. OV1 then stopped in the middle of the intersection, blocking both westbound lanes. The rider stated that she braked hard, causing the rear tire to lock and skid. She also honked her horn and attempted to turn left. The motorcycle went into a CCW yaw and she lost control when MC1 high sided onto its right side plane and slid into OV1. The tire mark starts in the left tire track of the #1 lane and crosses into the two-way left turn area. The rider stayed on MC1 to its FRP. The contact with OV1 was very minor according to the police report. The damage consisted of a scuff mark that could have been made by the rider?s shoe or one of the tires from MC1. MC1 left 31? 08? of rear tire mark skid. MC1 then slid 8?07? to its FRP. Neither vehicle was towed. The rider was treated at the scene by a passing ambulance crew. She
later went to a medical facility for additional treatment and was released.
RiderInj: The 49 year old female operator of MC1 sustained minor injuries consisting of a torn ligament in her left thumb, and some abrasions and contusions. The rider was wearing a light T-shirt, shorts, and athletic shoes. The rider of MC1 showed no signs of impairment that would otherwise inhibit her ability to operate a motor vehicle.
ODriverInj: The driver of OV1 was not injured and showed no signs of impairment.
Human: The driver of OV1 had a perception error. The rider of MC1 had a reaction failure with improper braking techniques.
Vehicle:
MC1 sustained minor damage mostly to the right side as a result of impacting the roadway and sliding. There was no reduction in wheelbase. The pre-crash condition would be labeled as very good.

OV1 sustained very minor damage consisting of a scuff mark. OV1 was not inspected. The pre-crash condition of OV1 is unknown.
Environmental: There were no environmental factors that were contributory to this crash.

CrashType: This was a motorcycle (MC1) vs. another vehicle (OV1) vs. another vehicle (OV2) traffic collision with a secondary lay-down event that caused the motorcycle to impact the roadway surface and tumble into OV2. The rider was ejected and sustained serious injuries.
MV1: 1998 Kawasaki ZX600 G1 Ninja (sport race replica) 599cc, red in color Other Vehicle (OV1):
OV1: 2012 Nissan Altima sedan (automobile) tan in color
OV2: 2012 Jeep Patriot SAV (automobile derivative) black in color
Crash:
This was a motorcycle vs. other vehicle vs. other vehicle traffic collision resulting in injuries to the motorcycle rider. The collision occurred on Friday, August 2013 at 1922 hours in Southern California. Sunset was at 1946 hours. The weather report for 1854 hours indicated clear skies, with southwest winds at 6.9 mph, and an ambient temperature of 66.9 degrees F. Visibility at ground level was clear and unobstructed in all directions. The roadway surface for MC1 had a 2.1% uphill grade with a 5.2% crown. The roadway surface was found to be dry of an asphalt composition which appeared to be worn and polished otherwise in satisfactory condition. There were no super-elevation issues with this roadway. The speed limit is posted 30 mph for both north and southbound traffic.
The collision occurred at an ?at grade? intersection of a minor arterial surface street with an overall travel-way width of 56 feet. The roadway is straight and runs east to west with two lanes dedicated for eastbound and two lanes dedicated for westbound traffic.
There are no designated left turn lanes to regulate both east and westbound traffic onto the intersecting commercial/residential street at this intersection. This intersecting local street has an overall travel-way of 40 feet on the north side of the intersection and, 40 feet on the south side of the intersection. The north and southbound lanes of the minor arterial street are not regulated by any posted or marked traffic control devices. The east and westbound lanes of the intersecting local street are regulated by posted stop signs at the intersection. The speed limit for the local street is 25 mph.
The opposing lanes of traffic are separated by painted solid double yellow line lane markers. The roadway is also bordered on all sides by raised concrete curbs and adjoining concrete sidewalks.

MC1 was a 1998 Kawasaki ZX600 G1 (sport race replica) style motorcycle being operated by a 24 year old male rider. The rider was travelling at a speed of about 50-60 mph, southbound in the designated #1 lane of the minor arterial surface street approaching the intersection. There were moderate traffic conditions at the time of the crash event.
OV1 was a 2012 Nissan Altima sedan being operated by a 65 year old female. OV1was approaching the intersection northbound in the #1 lane slowing for an intended left turn movement onto the westbound lane of the intersecting local street.
OV2 was a 2012 Jeep Patriot SAV (automobile derivative) being operated by a 26 year old female. OV2 was at a standing stop in the eastbound lane of the local street on the south side of the intersection.
When the driver of OV1 presumed it safe to proceed, she slowly began a left turn movement through the intersection. As the driver continued the turn she failed to notice MC1 approaching the intersection in the southbound #1 lane.
The rider collided with the center front portion of OV1 causing the motorcycle to collapse onto the roadway and tumble into OV2. The rider was ejected off the motorcycle across the front left portion of the engine hood. The rider vaulted off OV1 a distance of approximately 61 feet impacting with the roadway surface. He continued across the roadway surface impacting with a raised concrete curb, and possibly an adjacent a palm tree.
The motorcycle tumbled a distance of approximately 22 feet through the intersection and came down onto the right front quarter panel of OV2. MC1 came to rest right side down adjacent to OV2.
At the time of the collision there were no other vehicles, pedestrians, or animals that caused or contributed to the event. Other than the position of OV2 to the initial crash event, the driver of OV2 did not contribute anything to the cause or outcome.
RiderInj: The 24year old male rider of MC1 sustained serious injuries as a result of the collision. He was wearing a borrowed HJC Cyclone full face DOT approved motorcycle helmet with a Snell rating of M2005 (USA). The injuries sustained were that of a dissected Aorta, subdural hematoma, fractured Pelvis, fractures to both wrists and right leg. The rider was immediately removed from the scene to a local hospital for treatment. There is no further information available on the extent of injuries. There was no indication of drug and/or alcohol involvement.
ODriverInj: The drivers of OV1 and OV2 sustained no injuries. There was no indication of drug and/or alcohol involvement with either driver.
Human:
Due to his excessive rate of speed the rider of MC1 could not sufficiently react in time due to the proximity and position of OV1 to initiate a collision avoidance maneuver.
The driver of OV1 made an unsafe decision to turn having failed to notice the presence of MC1 while making her left turn movement.
Vehicle:
MC1 sustained major front end damage as a result of impacting OV1. MC1 appeared to have been in satisfactory operating condition prior to the crash event. OV1 sustained major front end damage. OV1 appeared to have been in satisfactory operating condition prior to the crash event.
OV2 sustained minor damage to the right front quarter panel as a result MC1?s impact after the initial crash event. Upon completion of the preliminary investigation the driver of OV2 was allowed to drive away.
Environmental: There were no environmental conditions that contributed to the cause or outcome of this crash event.

CrashType: Motorcycle vs. Automobile
Crash:
This two-vehicle crash occurred on a Tuesday in August 2013 at 1739 hours in Southern California. It was daylight, the temperature was between 79 and 82 degrees F. and the winds were S to SSW between 9.2 to 8.1 mph. The asphalt roadway surface was dry, noted to be travel worn and there was heavy congested traffic.

The crash occurred at a 4 way skewed uncontrolled intersection, on a straight north/south road that has a 3.1% positive northbound grade, 8.8% crown and a speed limit of 40 mph. There are two through lanes and one left turn lane in both directions in both directions. The west leg of the intersection is not involved in this crash. The east leg of the intersection is a single 20 ft. lane in each direction with a 3.1% grade and a 3.8% crown.
MC1 is a 2011 Suzuki GSX-R600 (599cc) Sport/race replica motorcycle ridden by a 25 year old male (5 ft. 7 in. and 170 lbs.) the MC1 passenger was a 20 year old female (5 ft. 2 in. and 115 lbs.). The rider was wearing a Shoei RF1100 full face helmet with a smoked colored face shield and was wearing an HJC CS-R2 full face helmet with a smoked colored face shield and the passenger was directly behind the rider. OV1 is a 2012 Ford Fiesta driven by a 25 year old male (6 ft. 1 in. and 175 lbs.). The driver of OV1 was reportedly wearing the available three-point manual lap and shoulder restraints.

MC1 was traveling north at approximately 35 mph in the right hand side of lane #2, passing stopped traffic approaching the uncontrolled intersection. OV1 was southbound stopped in the left turn lane making a left turn onto the east leg of the intersection. Neither the rider nor the driver saw each other. MC1 struck OV1 at a relative heading angle of 95 degrees at the A pillar, as OV1 rolled forward to its final rest position (FRP), MC1 pivoted clockwise, impacting the right side of OV1 and low sided onto its left side.
The rider of MC1 fell within 6 ft. of the point of impact (POI) while the passenger of MC1 was launched above ride height across the hood of OV1 and came to rest 20 ft. 7 in. north of the POI.
RiderInj:
The 25 year-old male rider of MC1 sustained the following injuries as related during the rider interview: muscle strains of the right
 shoulder, left hand and groin. The Injury Severity Score (ISS) was 1. The 20 year-old female passenger of MC1 sustained the following injuries as related during the passenger interview: left inferior/distal open tibia/ankle fracture, right posterior hand contusion and a middle leg abrasion.
ODriverInj: The 25 year-old male driver of OV1 was not injured. There was no drug or alcohol involvement.
Human: The 25 year-old male rider of MC1 had a decision failure along with operating MC1 in an unsafe/risk taking manner by passing stopped traffic adjacent to the right curb. This limited his visibility of southbound and crossing traffic.
Vehicle: There were no crash causation factors related to MC1 and OV1.
Environmental: There were no environmental crash causation factors.

CrashType: Motorcycle (MC1) lost control while the front tire was up in the air. MC1 impacted a curb with the rear tire and went down on its? right side plane, then impacted OV1 which was parked. MC1 had no passenger.
Crash:
This is a crash in which MC1 lost control while accelerating too fast over a speed bump in a parking lot thoroughfare to a large retail center. The rider of MC1 slowed for a speed bump and some pedestrians ahead. The pedestrians waved the rider through because they were elderly and walking very slow. The loss of control started when the motorcyclist began to accelerate while going over a speed bump. Per the witness, the front tire immediately came up off the ground and it appeared that the rider had no control. MC1 veered to the right, striking the curb to the planter area with its rear tire. The front tire was still up in the air. The rider was fully ejected and skidded/slid in a southerly direction into the next planter area. After striking the curb with its rear tire and ejecting the rider, MC1 continued in a southwesterly direction in an unknown dynamic, eventually landing on its right side plane and impacting OV1 which was parked and unoccupied. The thoroughfare is 30? wide and divided by a skip-dash single yellow painted line. On either side are curb high oval planters with trees and bushes. The planters are 36? long and run parallel as end caps to the double rows of 17? head to head parking stalls. There is a 23? space between planters.
There were no pre-impact tire marks of any kind from MC1. Gouges start prior to MC1 impacting OV1. MC1 has both front and rear damage. It appears that the front end damage is from impacting OV1. The broken rear rim may have been caused by striking a planter curb. The curbs were examined. All had several tire marks. None of the marks could be positively attributed to this crash. The overall dynamics of MC1 after the first harmful event in this crash are unknown. The parking lot was flat, level, made of an asphalt composition and in good condition. MC was proceeding in a southeasterly direction on the thoroughfare. The main portion of the parking lot would be on the riders? right. The painted parking stalls face each other in a northerly and southerly direction and run westerly through the lot towards the stores. There is no posted speed limit. There are no permanent visual obstructions that would be considered contributory to the crash. The diagram in the accident report shows OV1 parked in stall #2 at its FRP, along with MC1 next to it. When OV1 was inspected, the owner of OV1 said that it was parked in that stall. Scrapes found at the scene that were thought to have been made by MC1 have been dismissed as being involved which eliminates a lot of confusion as to conflicting statements and measurements. Adding to the confusion are measurements taken by the police that indicate the POI between MC1 and OV1 is further north and west from where the FRPs are which do not coincide with other crash dynamics. The crash occurred in Southern California in August of 2013 at 1155 hrs. The weather was cloudy, partly cloudy with a temperature of 74 degrees F. The wind was moderate from the SSW. Traffic conditions were light. It is unknown if the rider was ejected or stayed with MC1 to their FRPs. The rider sustained minor injuries.

MC1 was 2012 Yamaha YZF-R6 sport/racing type motorcycle that was being operated by a 20 year old male (6? 02?/205 lbs.) who did not participate for an interview. The rider said that he was going southbound through the parking lot and when he attempted to ride over the speed bump he gave MC1 too much gas and ?whiskey throttled? (sic) the accelerator and lost control. He was wearing an unknown make full face helmet with integral chin bar and face shield. The helmet has unknown ratings.

MC1 was southbound in the #1 lane at an unknown, but very slow speed to allow two elderly pedestrians to cross ahead of him. MC1 was also approaching a speed bump. When the pedestrians gave up their right of way, MC1 accelerated. It would appear that the rider inadvertently released the clutch completely along with too much throttle, causing MC1 to go into a wheelie. It is unknown what, if any contribution the speed bump had on this crash. MC1 then veered to the right and ran off the roadway into a curb high planter box. This impact fractured the rear rim causing the tire to go flat. The rider was fully ejected at that time and skidded/slid into the next planter area, impacting a tree and then some bushes. MC1 continued in a southwesterly direction. At some point, MC1 was on its right side plane. MC1 then impacted OV1 to the right front side. According to the witness, there was another vehicle parked in the next stall to the right of OV1. Somehow, MC1 made no contact with that other vehicle and ended up on its tires, facing in a northerly direction, leaning against the right side of OV1.
RiderInj: The 20 year old male operator of MC1 sustained minor injuries consisting of a concussion (he called the witness mom) and abrasions to his face, right arm, and both legs. He was taken to a local hospital where he was treated and released. It is unknown what, if any protective apparel the rider was wearing. The rider of MC1 showed no signs of impairment that would otherwise inhibit her ability to operate a motor vehicle.
ODriverInj: OV1 was properly and legally parked in a marked stall and was unoccupied at the time of the crash.
Human: The rider of MC1 had a reaction error. Based on the rider?s age and year of MC1, lack of experience may also come into play.
Vehicle:
MC1 sustained minor damage mostly to the front and right side. MC1 was equipped with what appears to be privately made crash bars covering the engine area. They are somewhat rough in appearance and not painted. There was no reduction in wheelbase. The pre-crash condition would be labeled as very good.

OV1 sustained minor visible damage consisting of dents and scratches to the right front side. The owner said that the frame was bent in the right front area. OV1 had other pre-existing damage to the front center and roof. The pre-crash condition of OV1 would be described as fair.
Environmental: The speed bump could be considered as a minor contribution to this crash.

CrashType: This was a motorcycle (MC1) vs. another vehicle (OV1) front end to right side impact traffic collision that resulted in fatal injuries to the rider and minor injuries to the driver of OV1. Both vehicles sustained total damage as a result of this crash event.
MV1: 2013 Kawasaki ZX-R6 Ninja sport race replica (636cc), black in color
OV1: 1997 Toyota Avalon 4 door sedan automobile, silver in color
Crash:
This was a motorcycle vs. other vehicle fatal traffic collision. The collision occurred on Thursday, August 2013 at 2226 hours in Southern California. The weather report for 2158 hours showed clear skies, northwest wind direction at 5.8 mph and an ambient temperature of 64.2 degrees F. Visibility was 10.0 miles clear and unobstructed for all directions of travel. On approach to the intersection the roadway surface for the motorcycle (MC1) had a 0.0% grade with a 3.4% crown. The roadway surface was found to be of an asphalt composition which appeared to be worn and polished otherwise in satisfactory condition. There were no super-elevation issues with this roadway.
The collision occurred at an at-grade four way signal controlled intersection of a major arterial non-freeway surface street with an overall travel-way width of 112 feet. The posted speed limit for both directions of travel is 45 mph. The roadway is straight and runs north and south with four lanes dedicated for northbound and four lanes dedicated for southbound traffic.
On both sides of the intersection there are two designated left turn lanes allowing north to westbound movement of traffic and south to eastbound movement.
The left turn lanes are regulated by a lagging green arrow. The north and southbound lanes of this roadway are separated by a three foot wide raised concrete divider.
The east west cross street is a minor arterial with an overall travel way width of 66 feet. The street has two westbound and two eastbound through lanes for traffic. There are also two designated left turn lanes for east to north and west to southbound movement of traffic. The left turn lanes are regulated by a lagging green arrow. The east and westbound lanes are separated by a set of painted solid double yellow lines. The posted speed limit for east and westbound lanes of traffic is 40 mph.
The surrounding environment adjacent to the intersection is occupied by commercial businesses and retail stores open to public access.

MC1 was a 2013 Kawasaki ZX-6R Ninja sport race replica (636cc) replica motorcycle being operated by a 26 year old male rider. The rider was travelling at an unusually high rate of speed northbound on the major arterial street splittingbetween the #3 and #4 traffic lanes while approaching the intersection.
 
OV1 was a 1997 Toyota Avalon 4 door sedan being operated by 35 year old male driver. OV1 was initially stopped for a red light at the intersection occupying the first position of the #2 (outside) south to eastbound left turn lane. The driver of OV1 received a fresh green arrow to proceed into the intersection. The driver of OV1 did not see or have any idea that MC1 was approaching the intersection at a high rate of speed. The driver of OV1 accelerated into the intersection while the northbound lanes of traffic were now stopped for a solid red light. OV1 was travelling at a speed of about 22 mph (32 fps).
The rider of MC1 continued northbound splitting lanes between the stopped traffic in the #3 & #4 lanes and was now at the intersection. The rider continued northbound passing over the marked crosswalk and entering the intersection having failed to notice or stop for the red light. The rider had moved into the plane of the intersection a distance of about 35 feet when OV1 crossed into his path. Witness accounts of MC1?s speed prior to impacting OV1 varied between 50 and 100 mph and there was no indication of the rider attempting to brake or commit to any type of collision maneuver. There was no evidence of skid marks or a lay down scrapes prior to impact.
MC1 struck OV1 at the right front passenger side door just behind the A-pillar causing the passenger door to collapse into the passenger compartment. The motorcycle intruded into the passenger compartment approximately 36 inches and included the rider. The impact stopped all forward motion of OV1 and redirected its movement in a type of northbound arc collapsing the left side tires and right rear tire. OV1 came to rest facing in a southwest direction approximately 29 feet north of its original direction of travel and 12 feet offset to the east.
During this redirection of OV1 both MC1 and the rider had been effectively captured into or about the passenger compartment. As the vehicle swung in its arc both the rider and MC1 fell out onto the roadway surface. The rider was dead at the scene and the driver of OV1 had sustained minor injuries having no recollection of the crash events.
RiderInj:
The 26 year old male rider of MC1 sustained fatal injuries as a result of the collision. The rider?s injuries included but were not limited to a complete transection of the Thoracic aorta, transection of the trachea and distal esophagus. Although the rider was wearing a motorcycle helmet he sustained numerous cranial and Le Fort 2 type fractures along with bilateral Cerebral hemorrhaging.
Autopsy results included evidence of both Amphetamine (1.2 mg/L) and Methamphetamine (2.0 mg/L) present in the rider.
ODriverInj: The 35 year old male driver of the other vehicle (OV1) sustained minor injuries and was treated and released at a local hospital.
Human:
The 26 year old male rider of MC1 was operating his motorcycle while under the influence of an intoxicant (illegal stimulant) and taking unnecessary risks with respect to other traffic on the roadway.
The 35 year old male driver of OV1 was proceeding at a safe speed abiding by traffic regulations and did not contribute anything to the cause or outcome of this crash event.
Vehicle:
MC1 sustained major front end damage as a result of this crash event however appeared to have been in satisfactory operating condition prior to the crash event.
OV1 sustained major right side damage however, appeared to have been in satisfactory operating condition prior to the crash event.
Environmental: There were no environmental factors that were determined to have contributed to the cause or outcome of this crash event.

CrashType: Motorcycle vs. Jeep
MV1: 2012 Kawasaki Ninja, ZX6R, 649 cc, sport, race replica
Crash:
This two-vehicle crash occurred in August 2013 at 1726 hours in Southern California. It was daylight, not bright, the weather was overcast, the temperature was approximately 72 degrees F and the winds were SSW at approximately 14 mph. The asphalt roadway surface was dry, noted to be travel worn, with moderate traffic.

The crash occurred on a straight east/west state highway in a residential/state park area. The roadway has two through lanes in both directions, with parallel parking spaces on both sides. The lanes are divided by a raised 2 ft. wide concrete center median and a 10 ft. wide painted divider on the westbound side. The speed limit is 45 mph. The roadway is bordered by raised curbing and a sidewalk on the westbound side and raised curbing and grass on the eastbound side.
MC1 is a 2012 Kawasaki Ninja ZX6R (649 cc) sport, race replica motorcycle ridden by a 31 year old male (5 ft. 9 in. and 260 lbs.). The rider was wearing an icon, Alliance (DOT/Snell) full face helmet with dark tinted face shield.    OV1 is a 1998 Jeep Wrangler driven by a 26 year old female (5 ft. 10 in. and 155 lbs.). The driver and 2 passengers of OV1 were reportedly wearing the available three-point manual lap and shoulder restraints.

OV1 was westbound, stopped approximately 115 ft. east of the intersection in the #2 lane for a red traffic signal. MC1 was traveling westbound, approaching OV1 from behind, weaving through traffic and lane splitting between lanes. The rider of MC1 had been drinking alcohol during the day and left a bar approximately 0.88 miles from the collision, where he had continued to drink alcohol. The rider?s blood was drawn; approximately 1 hr. and 53 min. after the accident to determine his level of intoxication. His BAC was 0.22. MC1 moved from the #1 lane into the #2 lane and attempted to pass OV1 on the right side, MC1 struck OV1 at the right rear bumper and tailgate at approximately 35 mph, causing an 11.5 in. front wheel reduction to MC1. The ?Point Of Impact? (POI) and the ?Point Of Rest? (POR) for MC1 is the same, approximately 146 ft. east of the east curb line of the intersection and approximately 16 ft. 8 in. south of the north curb line. The rider of MC1 came to rest approximately 10 ft. north of POI after striking OV1. OV1 moved forward approximately 6 ft. west of the POI to its POR.
RiderInj: The 31 year-old male rider of MC1 sustained the following injuries, as related in the police report and police photographs: a frontal skull fracture with loss of consciousness, multiple rib fractures, (Not Further Specified) (NFS); jaw fracture, NFS; loose teeth and bilateral knee abrasions. The Injury Severity Score (ISS) was (14).
ODriverInj: The 26 year-old male driver of OV1 was not injured.
Human: The 31 year-old male rider of MC1 was operating MC1 with a BAC of 0.22 at a high rate of speed weaving around traffic, attempting to pass OV1 on the right, failed and struck OV1.
Vehicle: The crash involved vehicles were in satisfactory operating condition prior to the crash, and were determined not to be a crash causal factor.
Environmental: There are no environmental crash causal factors.

CrashType: Motorcycle (MC1) lost control after being impacted by OV1 who was changing lanes to the left and into MC1. MC1 went down on its left side plane. MC1 had no passenger.
Crash:
This is a crash in which MC1 lost control after being impacted by OV1 who was making rapid lane changes to its left while going in the same direction as MC1. MC1 went down on its left side plane. The rider was fully ejected, landing onto the roadway and curb high raised center divider. He sustained moderate injuries. The rider was able to brake, while at the same time hit the driver?s window with his fist just prior to impact. After being impacted by OV1, MC1 impacted the raised divider. MC1 then continued in an easterly direction while being squeezed between OV1 and the divider. MC1 came to rest leaning against the center divider. OV1 separated from MC1 and relocated from its original FRP. OV1 had damage starting just forward of the left rear door on the rocker panel, sill area. The damage ended rear of the left rear tire in the quarter panel area. The crash occurred just east of a four way, not skewed intersection that had signal controls. Both roadways are major arterials. The roadway on which the crash occurred has two through lanes in both directions with a curb high raised center divider. The roadway on the right side has a bus turnout. The opposing direction has a dedicated left turn lane. The surrounding area on the right is an urban high school, and a single family residential area on the left. The roadway is in an east/west orientation at the crash site. The roadway is bordered by concrete curbs and sidewalks. No on-street parking is allowed. The roadway is straight and level with a 0.6% downgrade and 2.8% crown. The posted speed limit is 40 mph. There are no permanent visual obstructions that would be considered contributory to the crash. The roadway is made of an asphalt composition, and is worn and polished. It has some surface cracking and one large rectangular bitumen repair, but is in otherwise good condition. Pre-impact tire marks were visible from MC1. Following the tire mark from MC1 were some scrapes and gouges leading to its FRP. The crash occurred in Southern California in August of 2013 at 1320 hrs. The weather was clear with a temperature of 78 degrees F. The wind was light from the WNW. Traffic conditions were light to moderate. The rider was fully ejected and sustained moderate injuries.

MC1 was 1997 Honda CBR 900RR Fireblade sport/racing type motorcycle that was being operated by a 42 year old male (6? 01?/183 lbs.). The rider said that he was on his way to a client?s home from his home. He was wearing a full face Akuma helmet with integral chin bar and a reflective face shield. The helmet had
 
labeling for FMVSS 218 (DOT) and ECE-22-05 safety ratings.

The rider stated the he was in the #1 lane eastbound lane approaching an intersection that had a red light. He had braked and downshifted and was in the process of stopping when the light phased to green. He then accelerated, and proceeded through the intersection and up-shifted to second gear. MC1 was eastbound in the #1 lane at a stated speed of approximately 35 mph, which is below the posted speed limit of 40 mph. He said that he was leading a pack of vehicles. The rider stated that as he was almost through the intersection, OV1 made a right turn from the cross street. He stated that the turn was wide and forced him to brake. The rider said that the OV came right into his lane. The 71 year old male (6?00?/195 lbs.) driver of OV1 said he was eastbound in the #2 lane and had gone through the intersection with a green light. He stated that he was the third car in the pack. After clearing the intersection, the OV driver wanted to get into the left lane. He said that he looked in both his rear-view and left side mirrors, as well as turning his head, and never saw MC1. The driver stated that MC1 must have been in his blind spot. He only saw MC1 after he heard a ?thump? to the rear of his car. When he looked in his mirrors a second time, he saw the rider cartwheeling down the center divider. The driver also said that MC1 was pinned between his car and the center divider. The rider stated that he braked hard only with his rear brake and caused it to lock and skid. The POI was determined based on the deviation point of the skid. MC1 then went onto its left side against the center divider at approximately a 40-45 degree angle scraping against the divider until it came to its FRP. MC1 was towed. OV1 was driven away. The rider was treated at the scene and taken to a hospital where he was admitted for 3 days.
RiderInj: The 42 year old male operator of MC1 sustained moderate injuries consisting of a concussion, 7 fractured ribs, and numerous abrasions and contusions. The rider was wearing armored leather riding jacket and gloves, along with heavy work type boots. The rider of MC1 showed no signs of impairment that would otherwise inhibit her ability to operate a motor vehicle.
ODriverInj: The driver of OV1 was not injured and showed no signs of impairment.
Human: The driver of OV1 had a perception error.
Vehicle: MC1 sustained moderate damage to both sides as a result of the impact with OV1 and the roadway surface. MC1 had some pre-existing damage on both sides. There was no reduction in wheelbase. The pre-crash condition would be labeled as fair. OV1 sustained very minor damage consisting of scrapes and small gouges to the lower left side. OV1 was not inspected prior to repairs being made. The owner and repair facility provided us with post-crash photos. OV1 had some minor damage to the right front side that was pre-existing and not repaired. The pre- crash condition of OV1 would be considered good.
Environmental: There were no environmental factors that were contributory to this crash.

CrashType: This was a motorcycle (MC1) vs. another vehicle (OV1) traffic collision with a secondary lay-down event that caused the motorcycle to impact the roadway surface and the right front bumper of OV1. The rider (MCR) was ejected off of the motorcycle and impacted the right front quarter panel of OV1 causing fatal injuries.
MV1: 2003 Yamaha YZF R6 (sport race replica), 599cc, blue & red in color
OV1: 2011 Ford F-150 utility style pick-up truck, silver in color
Crash:
This was a motorcycle vs. other vehicle fatal traffic collision. The collision occurred on Thursday August 2013 at 0955 hours in Southern California. Sunrise was at 0620 hours. The weather report for 0953 hours showed scattered clouds, with winds out of the West at 4.6 mph. There was an ambient temperature of 80.1 degrees F. Visibility was 10.0 miles and at ground level it was clear and unobstructed in all directions. On approach to the intersection the roadway surface
for the motorcycle (MC1) had a 1.0% uphill grade with a 5.0% crown. The roadway surface was found to be of an asphalt composition which appeared to be dry, worn and polished otherwise in satisfactory condition. There were no super-elevation issues with this roadway.
The collision occurred at an ?at grade? T-intersection of a minor arterial surface street with an overall travel-way width of 84 feet. The roadway is straight and runs east to west with three lanes dedicated for eastbound and three lanes dedicated for westbound traffic. There is a 14 foot wide raised concrete median separating both east and westbound lanes of traffic. There is also a designated left turn lane allowing any eastbound traffic to turn northbound onto the 36 foot wide intersecting residential street. This street only opens along the north side of the minor arterial street and allows ingress and egress for north and southbound traffic.
There are no traffic control devices at the intersection other than a posted ?Stop? sign regulating southbound traffic entering the minor arterial street. On the south side of the intersection are commercial and industrial businesses open to the public. The posted speed limit for both directions of travel is 40 mph.
The north and south sides of the minor arterial street are bordered by raised concrete curbs and adjoining concrete sidewalks. The small businesses in the area are for the most part single story structures, however along the northeast portion of the intersection is a multi-story residential apartment complex with a parking area for public transportation.

MC1 was a 2003 Yamaha YZF R6 (599cc) sport race replica motorcycle being operated by a 19 year old male rider. The rider was wearing an HJC model CL-16 DOT approved full face motorcycle helmet with an M2010 Snell rating. The rider had accelerated to an estimated speed of approximately 40 mph, westbound in the designated #2 lane of the minor arterial street approaching the T-intersection and OV1.
 
OV1 was a 2011 Ford F-150 Pick-up truck being operated by a 49 year old male driver (OVD). OV1 was approaching eastbound in the left turn lane. OVD had been moving slowly and had stopped prior to making a desired U-turn movement once traffic cleared. OVD started his U-turn movement when he thought it was safe to do so but stopped suddenly when he saw the approach of MC1. OVD had initially observed MC1 turning onto his street from a signal controlled intersection east of his location approximately 320 feet away. OVD not only saw but could hear the rider accelerating out of his right turn towards his location. OVD initially thought he would have time to complete his U-turn movement thus allowing MC1 to proceed behind his truck. OVD decided instead to stop where he was and allow MC1 to go in front of him. When the OVD stopped his truck it was in a position blocking both the #1 and #2 westbound lanes of traffic. OVD had moved his truck a distance of about 31 feet from the left turn lane to its present position in the westbound lanes of traffic.
Based on the physical evidence and the OVD?s observations the rider attempted to brake and lay his bike down on the left side. The rider appeared to have applied his brakes leaving 46 feet of locked rear wheel skids and may have attempted a lane departure to the right. MC1 collapsed low side left sliding underneath the front bumper of OV1. The rider was ejected off his bike and subsequently struck the right front quarter panel of OV1 coming to rest alongside the vehicle. OVD exited his vehicle in an attempt to render aid. The rider was transported to a local hospital for emergency treatment however, succumbed to his injuries.
MC1 slid underneath the front bumper of OV1 and continued in a northeasterly direction until impacting the north curb face approximately 73 feet west of the crash site. MC1 continued another 20 feet sliding alongside the curb face until coming to rest, left side down adjacent to the raised concrete curb.
At the time of the collision there were no other vehicles, pedestrians, animals or, environmental conditions that caused or contributed to the event.
RiderInj: The 19 year old male rider of MC1 sustained fatal injuries as a result of the collision. The rider was immediately removed from the scene to a local hospital for treatment however succumbed to his injuries. The cause of death was an intra-abdominal hemorrhage due to vehicular blunt force trauma and a lacerated liver. There was no indication of drug and/or alcohol involvement.
ODriverInj: The 49 year old male driver of OV1 was not injured. During the investigation the driver voluntarily provided a blood sample for law enforcement officials.
Human: The 19 year old male rider of MC1 could not sufficiently react in time given the proximity and position of OV1 to initiate a collision avoidance maneuver. The 49 year old male driver of OV1 made an unsafe decision having failed to perceive the proximity of the approaching motorcycle while making his U-turn movement.
Vehicle:
MC1 sustained moderate front and left side damage as a result of impacting with the roadway surface and OV1. The motorcycle otherwise appeared to have been in satisfactory operating condition prior to the crash event.
OV1 sustained moderate right front damage however appeared to have been in satisfactory operating condition prior to the crash event.
Environmental: There were no environmental factors that were determined to have contributed to the cause or outcome of this crash event.

CrashType: Motorcycle vs. Automobile turning right
MV1: 2010 Harley Davidson XL883N (883cc) Conventional street motorcycle
Crash:
This two-vehicle motorcycle crash occurred in August 2013 at approximately 1647 hours in Southern California. It was daylight and partly cloudy; the temperature was approximately 90 degrees F and the winds were SW at approximately 8 mph. The asphalt roadway surface was dry, noted to be travel worn with surface cracking, and there was moderate traffic.

The crash occurred on the eastbound side of a predominately east/west roadway in a commercial area. MC1 was eastbound in the #1 lane and OV1 was northbound making a right turn from a commercial driveway into the #2 eastbound left turn lane. The eastbound roadway comprised three through lanes, a right turn lane and two left turn lanes. There is a signal controlled four way intersection approximately 150 ft. east of the Point of Impact (POI). The westbound portion of the roadway wasn?t involved with this crash. The roadway is divided by a raised wide concrete median. The eastbound grade is approximately 0.1% and the crown is approximately 3.3%.
MC1 is a 2010 Harley Davidson XL883N (883cc) Conventional street motorcycle ridden by a 48 year old male (5 ft. 3 in. and 116 lbs.). The rider was wearing a Davida Moto Engineering, open-faced Speedster helmet, without a face shield. This helmet doesn?t conform to any current safety standards,
per the manufacturer. OV1 is a 2003 Lexus RX300 Sport Utility vehicle driven by a 31 year old female (5 ft. 4 in. and 102 lbs.). There was one passenger in OV1 and both parties were reported to be using the required 3 point safety equipment.

MC1 was traveling at approximately 31 mph, approaching the intersection when OV1 exited the northbound driveway crossing eastbound traffic lanes and entering the #2 eastbound left turn lane. OV1 traveled approximately 52 ft. to the POI where it was struck on the left side front wheel by MC1. The rider of MC1 was launched over the hood of OV1 and slid approximately 71 ft. east to his Final Rest Position (FRP) into the #2 eastbound left turn lane where he slid under the rear bumper of a 2004 Toyota Camry which was stopped in the lane. There was no damage to the Toyota Camry. MC1 went down and slid approximately 60 ft. east to its FRP against the #1 eastbound left turn lane curb, facing south on its right side. OV1 continued its right turn into the #2 left turn lane and stopped at its FRP approximately 50 ft. east of the POI and approximately 18 ft. west of MC1 rider?s FRP.
RiderInj: The 48 year-old male rider of MC1 died as a result of the following injuries as noted in the Coroner?s report: Laceration and hemorrhages to the Corpus Callosum, subdural and subarachnoid hemorrhages, midbrain and brainstem hemorrhages with cerebral swelling and herniation. There were abrasions and contusions to the face, upper extremities, torso and knees. The Injury Severity Score (ISS) for the rider was 75, due to the severity score of 5 automatically makes the ISS total 75. The rider wasn?t under the influence of drugs or alcohol.
ODriverInj: The driver of OV1 was not injured during this collision. Alcohol was not a factor in this crash.
Human: The driver of OV1 failed to perceive MC1 prior to starting her right turn.K178
Vehicle: There were no vehicle crash causation factors for this crash.
Environmental: There were no environmental crash causation factors for this crash.

CrashType: Motorcycle (MC1) went wide in a left curve and ran off the road. MC1 impacted a curb, fully ejecting the rider. MC1 went down on its left side plane and slid to its FRP. MC1 had no passenger.
Crash:
This is a single MC crash in which MC1 went wide in a left turn and ran off the roadway. MC1 impacted the curb, which fully ejected the rider. The impact with the curb also broke the front forks and front rim, causing total deflation of the front tire. The rider landed in soft dirt that was newly landscaped with small flowers and bushes. There is a 5? sidewalk on the opposite side of the street. MC1 went onto its left side plane and slid/tumbled to its FRP. The impact with the curb broke the front forks and flattened the front tire. MC1 slid for approximately 86? more feet before coming to rest. The crash took place under a freeway overpass. There were no pre-impact tire marks visible when the scene was inspected the day after the crash; however, the police accident report indicates
36? of tire friction marks leading to the POI. MC1 skidded and slid along the curb on its left side plane before coming to its FRP. MC1 slid mostly front end first. It appears to have rotated in a CW direction at its FRP. The crash occurred in a transitional area north of a ?T? type intersection on a collector road for a single family residential area that the rider had just ridden through, and was changing to a commercial zone. The roadway is an undivided two way road with double yellow lines at the crash site. The roadway has a left curve on the approach to the crash site and is almost level after a negative 6.3% downgrade. The posted speed limit is 30 mph. The roadway has spot illumination. The roadway is made of an asphalt composition, is worn and polished, with some cracking, but otherwise in good condition. The roadway is in an east/west orientation at the crash site. On-street parking is not allowed on either side of the roadway. The roadway curvature at the crash site has a radius of 834?. It has a crown of +2.4% and a grade of -0.6%. There are no permanent visual obstructions that would be considered contributory to the crash. The crash occurred in Southern California in September of 2013 at 2105 hrs. The weather was cloudy/partly cloudy with a temperature of 75 degrees F. The wind was calm. Traffic conditions were light. The rider was fully ejected and sustained moderate injuries.

MC1 was 2009 Yamaha YZF-R6 sport/racing type motorcycle that was being operated by a 27 year old male (6? 00?/320 lbs.). The rider stated he was riding with a friend from a nearby gym and on their way to a fast food burger location. The rider was in the lead position. He stated that he was not familiar with the roadway and misjudged the turn. He stated that he hit the curb and was ejected, landing in the dirt. The rider said that he was in the right hand (#2) lane. The rider over-braked prior to impacting the curb. Based on minimum speed calculation for skid/slide/distance, the rider was traveling between 45-50 mph. The
 
motorcycle that the rider was on could have very easily negotiated the curve which leads this investigator to believe that the rider had a lack of riding skills or training. The rider was wearing an unknown style helmet with unknown safety ratings. It is unknown if the helmet sustained any damage or prevented/reduced any injury. It is also unknown what if any protective apparel the rider may have been wearing. Based on the injuries sustained (dislocated shoulder, leg fracture, abrasions), upper and lower apparel most likely would not have prevented the more serious of the injuries. The rider was treated at the scene and taken to a local hospital. It is unknown if the rider was treated/released or admitted. The rider?s friend was riding behind and stated that the rider hit the curb and flew over the handlebars landing in the dirt, then got up and walked over near a guardrail and laid down until help arrived. The crash occurred at night; however the area is well lit with spot illumination at the intersection and under the freeway overpass where the crash occurred. MC1 was towed.
RiderInj: The 27 year old male operator of MC1 sustained moderate injuries consisting of a fracture of the right tibia, a dislocated right shoulder, and abrasions. The rider of MC1 showed no signs of impairment that would otherwise inhibit his ability to operate a motor vehicle.
Human: The rider of MC1 had a reaction failure in over-braking and not turning.
Vehicle: MC1 sustained major damage to the front end as a result of the curb impact and minor damage to the left side as a result of sliding on the roadway surface. The forks and handlebars were separated from MC1. There was a maximum reduction in wheelbase in which the front tire was pushed backwards into the radiator, exhaust, and engine. A static measurement was not possible because of the separation of the forks from the rest of MC1. The pre-crash condition would be labeled as very good.
Environmental: There were no environmental factors that were contributory to this crash.

CrashType: Motorcycle vs. Automobile
Crash:
This two-vehicle crash occurred in September 2013 at 0750 in Southern California. It was daylight, overcast, the temperature was approximately 70 degrees F and the winds were calm. The asphalt roadway surface was dry, noted to be in good condition, and there was heavy traffic.

The crash occurred on the eastbound side of an east/west street in a commercial area east of a north/south interstate. On the eastbound side there are 2 through lanes with a single left turn lane entry that widens into 2 left turn lanes. On the westbound side there are 2 through lanes and a right turn lane for the interstate onramp. The street is divided by a painted double yellow stripe.	The speed limit is 35 mph, the eastbound grade is +0.1 % with a +2.7% crown.
MC1 is a 2008 Honda CBR600RR (599cc) motorcycle ridden by a 28 year old male (5 ft. 10 in. and 200 lbs.). The rider was wearing a Scorpion EXO 500 full-face helmet with damage from a prior accident. OV1 is a 2003 Chevrolet Tahoe driven by an 18 year old male (5 ft. 11 in. and 185 lbs.). The driver of OV1 was reportedly wearing the available three-point manual lap and shoulder restraints.

MC1 was traveling eastbound in the #1 lane approaching stopped traffic which was in the # 1 lane and angled into the left turn pocket. OV1 was stopped, eastbound in the #1 lane and angled into the left turn pocket.	As MC1 neared the rear of OV1, the rider of MC1 attempted to pass OV1 on the right side.	The rider of MC1 clipped the right rear bumper area of OV1 (Area of Impact # 1) at an angle of approximately -44 ? with his left knee.	MC1 high sided onto its right side (Area of Impact # 2) and slid into the right curb face (Area of Impact # 3).	AOI-1 is approximately 72 ft. 8 in. east of the east curb-line prolongation of the northbound interstate off-ramp and approximately 28 ft. north of the south curb-line. AOI-2 is approximately 75 ft. east of the east curb-line prolongation of
the northbound interstate off-ramp and approximately 22 ft. north of the south curb-line. AOI-3 is approximately 89 ft. east of the east curb-line prolongation of the northbound interstate off-ramp. MC1 and rider did not separate; AOI-3 and Point of Rest are the same.
RiderInj:
The 28 year-old male rider of MC1 was riding with a broken left clavicle sustained in a motorcycle crash the week prior and sustained
 
the following injuries as related on the emergency room record:	re-broken left collar bone, 4-5 in. laceration right inner lower leg, abrasion to left shoulder, abrasions to anterior right leg, abrasion right ankle bone.	The Injury Severity Score (ISS) was 5. Alcohol was not a factor in this crash.
Human: The rider of MC1
Vehicle: MC1 had damage from a prior accident.
Environmental: There were no environmental crash causation factors.

CrashType: Motorcycle (MC1) went wide in a left curve and ran off the road. MC1 impacted a curb and a block wall before going down on its left side plane and sliding to its FRP. MC1 had no passenger.
Crash:
This is a single MC crash in which MC1 went wide in a left turn and ran off the roadway. MC1 impacted the curb, then a block wall. After impacting the block wall, MC1 impacted it again and scraped along it for a distance of approximately 13?. The rider then lost control and MC1 went down on its left side plane. MC1 slid for approximately 97? before coming to rest. All of the tire marks and scrapes prior to this, MC1 was at an undetermined lean angle with both tires still making contact with the sidewalk surface along with some portion of the frame or footboards. The rider stayed with MC1 through the entire crash sequence and landed within 6? of MC1 at the FRP. There were no pre-impact tire marks. MC1 skidded and slid along the sidewalk, then impacted a block wall two times before completely losing control and falling onto its left side plane. MC1 slid mostly front end first. It appears to have rotated in a CW direction at its FRP. The crash occurred north of a ?T? type intersection on a collector road in a single family residential area. On the rider?s right is the residential zone. On the left is a nature preserve. There is a chain link fence separating the roadway from the preserve. The roadway is an undivided two way road with double yellow lines.
Each lane is 20?. There is a 5? sidewalk on the right and a 2? dirt edge on the left between the curb and fence. The roadway is straight on the approach to the crash site. At the crash site, the roadway has an ?S? curve, beginning with a left curve. The posted speed limit is 30 mph. The road has spot illumination. The roadway is made of an asphalt composition, is worn and polished, but otherwise in good condition. The roadway has a north/south dedication, but at the crash site is runs in a northwest/southeast orientation. The rider was northbound. On-street parking is allowed on both sides of the roadway. The roadway curvature at the crash site has a radius of 626?. It has a crown of +3.8% and a grade of +0.1%.	There are no permanent visual obstructions that would be considered contributory to the crash. The crash occurred in Southern California in August of 2013 at 2201 hrs. The weather was overcast with a temperature of 70 degrees F. The wind was light from the S. Traffic conditions were light. The rider was fully ejected and sustained moderate injuries

The rider was wearing an unknown style or brand of helmet with unknown safety ratings. The rider has a driver?s license for automobiles, but it is not endorsed for motorcycles.
MC1 was 1996 Harley Davidson Heritage Softail cruising type motorcycle that was being operated by a 60 year old male (5? 11?/210 lbs.). The rider said that he
 
as going too fast and was unable to make the curve in the roadway. He stated that he drove over the curb and then collided with a block wall. It is unknown what if any other protective apparel was worn by the rider. Based on the injuries listed in the police accident report, it would appear that no other protective gear was worn. The roadway is straight prior to the left curve. It is unknown where the rider was coming from, but he lives less than one mile from the crash scene and was headed in the direction of his home. It is likely that the rider was familiar with this roadway. Drugs/alcohol involvement was not a factor.
Seven days after the crash, the rider?s wife returned a phone call and stated that her husband was still in the hospital and that they did not want to participate. Since the rider did not participate for an interview, it is unknown how long he has been riding or what if any training he has had. It is unknown how long the rider was in the hospital beyond the seven days from the crash. MC1 sustained damage to all sides, including the undercarriage. MC1 was towed.
There was no reduction in wheelbase.
RiderInj: The 60 year old male operator of MC1 sustained moderate injuries as listed in the police accident report consisting of what is listed as severe cuts (lacerations) to the right foot, numerous lacerations and abrasions to the knees, hands, and arms. The rider was still in the hospital seven days after the crash, so there could be more serious injuries that were sustained and not documented in the accident report. The rider of MC1 showed no signs of impairment that would otherwise inhibit his ability to operate a motor vehicle.
Human: The rider of MC1 had a reaction failure by making no attempts to brake or turn in trying to prevent the crash.
Vehicle: MC1 sustained moderate damage to the front end, both sides, and the undercarriage as a result of the impact with the curb, block wall, and the roadway surface. MC1 appeared to be in very good condition prior to the crash. There was no reduction in wheelbase.
Environmental: There were no environmental factors that were determined to be contributory to this crash.

OV1: 2003 Harley Davidson, XL1200 Custom, 1199 cc, conventional street motorcycle, with modifications
Crash:
This single vehicle crash occurred in September 2013 at approximately 0150 hours in Southern California. It was night with spot illumination, the weather was overcast, the temperature was approximately 66 degrees F. and the winds were SW at approximately 3.5 mph. The asphalt roadway surface was dry, noted to be travel worn, with light traffic.

The crash occurred at a signal controlled ?T? intersection, on an east/west state highway that has a westbound right-hand curve with a 1250.5 ft. radius and
an overall length of 1130 ft.	Before the Area of Impact (AOI) there is 310 ft. of curve.	At the AOI there is a westbound uphill grade of 0.8% and a +6.1% grade prior to the AOI. There are single family homes on both the north and south sides, with the uninvolved base of the ?T? on the south side. The westbound roadway has a 4 ft. wide concrete center median, two through lanes, a left turn lane and a bike lane. The eastbound roadway has two through lanes, a right turn lane, a bike lane and on the west side of the intersection there is a westbound merge lane for north-westbound left turns. The speed limit is 50 mph.	The roadway is bordered by raised curbing and a sidewalk on the south side and raised curbing and grass on the north.
MC1 is a 2003 Harley Davidson XL1200 Custom Softtail, 1199 cc conventional street motorcycle, with modifications ridden by a 34 year old male (5 ft. 5 in. and 150 lbs.).	The rider was reportedly wearing an unknown make/style helmet.	MC1 was traveling westbound at approximately 55 mph approaching the intersection, negotiating the curve. MC1 drifted left into the center median, where it fell onto its left side and slid approximately 39 ft. along the curb before striking a metal sign.	MC1 then continued another 107 ft. west before coming to rest in the eastbound # 1 lane. The rider was ejected at an unknown time and came to rest face down.
RiderInj: The 34 year-old male rider of MC1 sustained the following injuries, as related in the police report: a left femur fracture ?Not Further Specified? (NFS), left tibia laceration NFS and a laceration in the mouth.	The rider had a BAC of 0.18, determined by a blood test administered at an unknown time after the accident. The Injury Severity Score (ISS) was (10).
Human: The 34 year-old male rider of MC1 was operating MC1 with a BAC of 0.18 and failed to negotiate the uphill curve.
Vehicle: There are no vehicle crash causation factors.
Environmental: There are no environmental crash causation factors.

CrashType: Motorcycle (MC1) loses control and goes down on its right side plane in collision avoidance with Non-Contact OV1 who makes a lane change into MC1?s lane of travel. MC1 had no passenger.
Crash:
This crash occurred on a non-freeway major arterial just prior to an at-grade, slightly skewed, four-way type intersection with signal controls. The roadway has an east/west designation and is in that orientation. The roadway has 3 through lanes in each direction and dedicated left turn lanes. There is a curb high raised center divider. MC1 was eastbound when OV1 made a lane change to the right, cutting off MC1. Traffic was moderate.	MC1 over-braked and lost control, falling on its right side plane. There was no contact with OV1, which did return to the scene. MC1 had a rear wheel lock up and low-sided, sliding forward, and then rotated CW and came to rest in the #1 lane facing in a southerly direction. There was no skid patch on the rear tire and no visible tire marks on the roadway surface. There was approximately 5? of scrapes on the roadway going from the POI to the FRP. The rider?s FRP was in the #2 lane about 10? away from MC1. The rider of MC1 lost control while attempting collision avoidance. MC1 never made contact with OV1. The rider was fully ejected and slid/skidded approximately 5? from the POI across the roadway surface to her FRP.	Both sides of the roadway have commercial businesses. The roadway is bordered by concrete curbs and 7? concrete sidewalks. The roadway is straight and level with a 0.5% upgrade and +1.87% crown. The posted speed limit is 40 mph. There are no permanent visual obstructions that would be considered contributory to the crash. The roadway is made of an asphalt composition, and is worn and polished. It has a few tar snakes, but is in otherwise good condition. The crash occurred in Southern California in September of 2013 at 1944 hrs. The weather was partly cloudy with a temperature of 67 degrees F. The wind was light from the SSW. Traffic conditions were moderate. The rider sustained moderate injuries. MC1 had no reduction in wheelbase. MC1 was towed. OV1 was driven away.

MC1 was a 2012 Royal Endfield conventional retro style motorcycle that was being operated by a 21 year old female (5? 07?/120 lbs.). She was wearing an open face helmet with a clear face shield and visor. It had markings showing that it was FMVSS-218 (US DOT) compliant. The helmet sustained minor abrasions and did prevent rider injury. The helmet was retained on the rider?s head to the end of the crash event.
 
The rider stated that she was traveling eastbound in the #2 lane going with the flow of traffic at approximately 40 mph. when OV1 suddenly made a lane change to the right, in front of her and cutting her off. She stated she braked hard with both brakes, locking the rear. The MC went into a CW rotation and went down low-side first on its right side plane. The 42 year old female operator (5?04?/135 lbs.) of OV1 said that she put on her turn signal and made a lane change, never seeing MC1. A witness stated that OV1 made a quick lane change without proper clearance and cut off MC1. OV1 then made a right turn onto the cross street. There were no statements as to how close OV1 and MC1 were when the lane change took place. The rider was unable to estimate the distance but said that it was very close and that OV1 did not signal the lane change. It is unknown how much braking the rider of MC1 was able to do before locking up the rear brake and losing control. The rider was treated at the scene and taken to a local hospital where she was admitted for four days.
RiderInj: The 21 year old female operator of MC1 sustained moderate injuries consisting of proximal fractures to the right radius and ulna, an abrasion to her chin, right hip, bilateral abrasions to wrists, hands, and knees. The rider was not wearing any protective apparel. The rider of MC1 showed no signs of impairment that would otherwise inhibit her ability to operate a motor vehicle.
ODriverInj: The driver of OV1 was not injured. She showed no signs of impairment.
Human: The driver of OV1 had a perception error in not seeing MC1 when she made a quick lane change to the right. The rider had a reaction failure in over-braking, causing the slide-out.
Vehicle:
MC1 sustained minor damage consisting mostly of scratches to the front fender and portions of the right side. The rider?s right foot peg was broken, but still useable. MC1 was still ridable.There was no reduction in wheelbase. The pre-crash condition would be labeled as like new.
OV1 was not inspected. There was no contact made between OV1 and MC1. The pre-crash and post-crash condition of OV1 would be the same and is unknown.
Environmental: There were no environmental factors that were contributory to this crash.

CrashType: This was a motorcycle (MC1) vs. another vehicle (OV1) traffic collision with a secondary lay-down event that caused the motorcycle to impact the roadway surface ejecting the rider causing minor injuries.
MV1: 1994 Kawasaki ZX7R Ninja (sport race replica) 748cc, green in color
OV1: 2013 Toyota Corolla sedan (automobile) blue in color
Crash:
This was a motorcycle vs. other vehicle traffic collision resulting in injuries to the motorcycle rider. The collision occurred on Sunday, September 2013 at 1759 hours in Southern California. Sunset was at 1840 hours. The weather report for 1753 hours indicated clear skies, with southwest winds at 6.9 mph, and an ambient temperature of 75.9 degrees F. Visibility at ground level was clear and unobstructed in all directions. The roadway surface for MC1 had a +0.2 uphill grade with a 4.1% crown. The roadway surface was found to be dry of an asphalt composition which appeared to be worn and polished otherwise in satisfactory condition. There were no super-elevation issues with this roadway.
The collision occurred at an ?at grade? slightly skewed intersection of a major non-freeway arterial surface street with an overall travel-way width of 78 feet. For MC1 there is a left curve radius of 834 feet and 420 foot length of curve. For OV1 the roadway is straight approaching the intersection. The roadway runs north and southbound with two lanes dedicated for northbound and two lanes dedicated for southbound traffic. The north and southbound through lanes are separated by a painted 13 foot wide two way left turn lane open to both directions of travel.
There are no dedicated left turn only lanes to regulate both north and southbound traffic onto the intersecting commercial street at this intersection only the two way left turn lane.
Along the east side of the street is intersected by a 45 foot wide driveway that allows for ingress and egress into a commercial shopping center. Along the
west side the street is intersected by a 31 foot wide local street that was uninvolved in this crash event.	The north and southbound lanes of the major arterial street are not regulated by any posted or marked traffic control devices other than the post 45 mph speed limit signs. The east and westbound lanes of the intersecting street are regulated by posted and marked stop signs at the intersection.	There is no posted speed regulation for the intersecting driveway and street.
The roadway is also bordered on the east side by raised concrete curbs and adjoining concrete sidewalks. There are no curbs or sidewalks along the west side of the street.
MC1 was a 1994 Kawasaki ZX7R (sport race replica) style motorcycle being operated by a 34 year old male rider.	The rider was travelling at a speed of about
 
50 mph, northbound in the designated #1 northbound lane of the major arterial surface street approaching the intersection. There were moderate traffic conditions at the time of the crash event.
OV1 was a 2013 Toyota Corolla sedan being operated by an 86 year old male. OV1was approaching the intersection southbound in the two way left turn lane slowing and stopping for an intended left turn movement into the commercial shopping center.

The driver of OV1 stopped prior to his turn, waited for two northbound vehicles to pass, presumed it safe to proceed, and initiated his left turn movement through the intersection. As the driver continued the turn he failed to notice MC1 approaching the intersection in the northbound #1 lane.
The rider had noticed OV1 starting the left turn and began to move his bike from the #1 lane to the #2 lane (to his right). Anticipating an impact the rider applied his rear brake leaving approximately 25 feet of locked skid prior to impacting with OV1. MC1 struck OV1 front end to right rear quarter panel of OV1. The resulting impact caused the rider to vault over the rear of OV1 and on to the roadway surface. MC1 collapsed left side down on to the roadway surface. Both the rider and the bike had been cleared off the roadway prior to emergency service personnel arrival.
At the time of the collision there were no other vehicles, pedestrians, or animals that caused or contributed to the event.
RiderInj: The 34year old male rider of MC1 sustained minor injuries as a result of the collision. He was wearing an unknown style motorcycle helmet as indicated in the police report. The injuries sustained were that of an abrasion to the right knee, a sprain to the right forearm and complaint of pain to the left shoulder.	The rider was removed from the scene to a local hospital for treatment. There is no further information available on the extent of injuries. Police Officers noticed the objective symptoms of alcohol intoxication on MC1. He was subsequently arrested for driving under the influence and released at the hospital pending his blood alcohol results. Blood test results revealed a BAC of 0.15 (legally impaired).
ODriverInj: The driver of OV1 sustained no injuries and there was no indication of drug and/or alcohol involvement. Officers filed a ?Request for Re-examination? to the Department of Motor Vehicles, concerning OV1?s ability to drive.
Human:
The rider of MC1 could not sufficiently react in time due to the proximity and position of OV1 to initiate a collision avoidance maneuver. There was also the involvement of alcohol.
The driver of OV1 made an unsafe decision to turn having failed to notice the presence of MC1 while making his left turn movement.
Vehicle:
MC1 sustained major front end damage as a result of impacting OV1 however appeared to have been in satisfactory operating condition prior to the crash event.
OV1 sustained moderate right side damage however, appeared to have been in satisfactory operating condition prior to the crash event.
Environmental: There were no environmental conditions that contributed to the cause or outcome of this crash event.

CrashType: Motorcycle vs. Automobile
MV1: 2006 Honda CBR600 (599cc) Sport, race replica motorcycle
Crash:
This two-vehicle crash occurred in October 2013 at 1255 hours in Southern California.	It was daylight, clear, the temperature was approximately 77 degrees F and the winds were approximately 8.1 mph out of the SSW. The asphalt roadway surface was dry, noted to be travel worn, and there was moderate traffic.

The crash occurred at a 4 way residential intersection. The north/south roadway is undivided and has 2 through lanes in each direction separated by a double yellow center line, a speed limit of 35 mph, a northbound grade of 1.0% and a 7.8% crown.	The east/west roadway is undivided with a single lane in each direction separated by a double yellow center line, a speed limit of 25 mph and a grade of 0.0% and a 3.4% crown.
MC1 is a 2006 Honda CBR600 (599cc) Sport, race replica motorcycle ridden by a 31 year old male (6 ft. and 185 lbs.). The rider was wearing a DOT approved, Bell, Arrow helmet with a missing face shield. OV1 is a 2008 Honda Accord driven by a 24 year old female (5 ft. 4 in. and 120 lbs.). The driver of OV1 was reportedly wearing the available three-point manual lap and shoulder restraints.

MC1 was traveling northbound at approximately 35 mph, approaching the intersection in the #1 lane. OV1 was westbound stopped at the limit line waiting to proceed through the intersection. The signal phased red as MC1 approached the intersection. OV1 entered the intersection with a green phased signal, MC1 failed to stop for the red signal due to a broken/partially detached right front brake lever, which only allowed one finger to work the front brake and struck OV1 in the left driver?s door, at an estimated speed of 21 mph.
