The Point of Impact (POI) was approximately 15 ft. 9 in. south of the north curb line and approximately 23 ft. 4 in. west of the east curb line. MC1 pivoted left as OV1 continued westbound and came to rest on its left side approximately 10 ft. southwest of the POI. The rider of MC1 vaulted over OV1 coming to rest approximately 32 ft. northwest of the POI. After the impact, the driver of OV1 became momentarily disoriented, then pulled to the right curb approximately 45 ft. west of the west curb line.
RiderInj:
The 31 year-old male rider of MC1 sustained the following injuries as related on the police report: broken arm/leg ?Not Further
 Specified? (NFS) and internal injuries NFS.	The Injury Severity Score (ISS) was 4.
ODriverInj: The 24 year-old female driver of OV1 sustained the following injuries as related on the police report: cuts to face and head NFS. There was alcohol involvement by the rider of MC1 approximately 2 hours prior to the collision.
Human: The 31 year-old male rider of MC1 has a history of failing to stop for red phased traffic signals. There was a possible perception failure by the 24 year-old female driver of OV1, as she entered the intersection.
Vehicle: MC1 had a broken hand brake lever, which contributed to the riders inability to safely stop MC1 in the proper time/distance.
Environmental: There were no environmental crash causation factors.

CrashType: Motorcycle (MC1) has frontal impact with OV1 right rear side which was making a left turn at a non-signal controlled ?T? intersection. MC1 went down on its left side plane. MC1 had no passenger.
Crash:
This crash occurred on a non-freeway major arterial at an at-grade, not skewed, ?T? type intersection. The roadway has a north/south designation and is in that orientation. The roadway has 3 through lanes in each direction and dedicated left turn lanes. There is a curb high raised divider. MC1 was southbound when OV1 made a north to westbound left turn in front of it. Traffic was moderate. The intersection has no signal controls. There is a stop sign for the intersecting side street. MC1 had a frontal impact to the right rear side of OV1. The first contact point was at the trailing edge of the right rear door. The impact caused both right side airbag curtains to deploy and OV1 to go into a nearly 180 degree CW rotation and roll backwards to its FRP facing east. OV1 made some tire friction makes as it rotated approximately 40? to its FRP. There were no pre-impact tire marks from either vehicle. MC1 went down on its left side plane and slid approximately 18? while rotating in a CW manner to its FRP, facing west. The rider was fully ejected and slid/skidded approximately 49? from the POI across the roadway surface to his FRP. The crash occurred in the #2 of 3 lanes. The #3 lane is 20? wide to allow for on-street parking. Both sides of the roadway have commercial businesses, comprised mostly of new/used car lots. The front rim was folded nearly in half and the front tire was deflated. The roadway is bordered by concrete curbs and 15? concrete sidewalks. The roadway is straight and level with a 0.5% upgrade and 7.7% crown. The posted speed limit is 50 mph. There are no permanent visual obstructions that would be considered contributory to the crash. The roadway is made of an asphalt composition, and is worn and polished. It has some surface cracking along the roadway edge, but is in otherwise good condition. The crash occurred in Southern California in October of 2013 at 1517 hrs. The weather was partly cloudy with a temperature of 72 degrees F. The wind was moderate from the south. Traffic conditions were moderate. The rider sustained moderate to major injuries. MC1 had a large reduction in wheelbase. Both vehicles were towed.

MC1 was a 1997 Harley Davidson Sportster cruiser type motorcycle that was being operated by a 29 year old male (6? 00?/200 lbs.). He was wearing an unknown style helmet with unknown safety ratings. The helmet was retained on the rider?s head to the end of the crash event and went with him to the hospital.
 
The rider stated that he had no recollection of the crash. Witnesses said that the rider was possibly in the #1 lane and swerved to the right as OV1 made its left turn in front of MC1 without stopping. Witnesses said that MC1 was traveling at approximately 45 mph, which was the speed that they were going. The 64 year old female (5?03?/147 lbs.) driver of OV1 was in the northbound left turn lane. She stated that the nearest traffic was up the road by the trees in the center divider (approximately 250? from the POI) and that MC1was in the southbound left lane. She saw him with a pack of cars and saw that she had plenty of time to make her turn. She stated that all of a sudden there was a loud ?thump? and her car was spinning in a circle. She stated that MC1 must have accelerated and steered to his right, into her turn, then hit her in the #2 lane. The impact caused the front forks of MC1 to turn to the right and collapse rearward making contact with the engine/frame. The front rim was folded nearly in half and the front tire was deflated. The rider?s clothing left visible scuff marks on the roadway surface from the point he landed to his FRP. The first visible clothing marks start approximately 24? south of the POI. The rider was treated at the scene and taken to a hospital where he was admitted for an unknown number of days.
RiderInj: The 29 year old male operator of MC1 sustained moderate to severe injuries consisting of fractures to his right arm and leg, abrasions, and a concussion based on his lack of memory regarding the crash. It is unknown what the rider was wearing and whether or not it prevented/reduced any injuries. The rider of MC1 showed no signs of impairment that would otherwise inhibit his ability to operate a motor vehicle.
ODriverInj: The driver of OV1 stated that she had contusions to both her thighs from the seatbelt and a minor laceration on the left side of her neck, also from the seatbelt. She refused medical attention at the scene, stating she would seek her medical services later. She showed no signs of impairment.
Human: The driver of OV1 had a decision error. The rider also had a decision error in swerving to the right.
Vehicle: MC1 sustained major damage to the front end, frame, and left side as a result of the impact with OV1 and the roadway surface. MC1 had a measured reduction in wheelbase of 14.7? The frame was fractured at the steering neck. The pre-crash condition would be labeled as fair.OV1 sustained moderate to major damage consisting of denting, a bent right rear wheel/axle, and broken windows. The pre-crash condition of OV1 would be considered very good.
Environmental: There were no environmental factors that were contributory to this crash.

CrashType: This was a motorcycle vs. fixed object (roadway surface) with the left side of the motorcycle impacting the roadway, after a failed attempt by the rider to correct a	rear tire slide out. The motorcycle rider was ejected off the bike and sustained non-life threatening injuries as a result of impacting with the roadway surface. There were no passengers on the motorcycle or other vehicles involved.
MV1: 2007 Suzuki GSXR sport race replica style motorcycle (599cc) red/white
Crash:
This was a motorcycle vs. fixed object (roadway surface) type traffic collision causing non-life threatening injuries to the rider. The collision occurred on Friday, October 2013 at 1815 hours in Southern California. The weather report showed clear skies, a West wind @ 5.8 mph, and an ambient temperature of +68.0 degrees F. Sunset was at 1823 hours.
The collision occurred near an ?at grade? four way intersection controlled by multi-phase signal lights. The north/south lanes have an overall travel way width of 104 feet and three lanes serving both direction of travel. The intersecting east/west lanes also have an overall travel way width of 63 feet on the west side of the intersection with two lanes for each direction. Along the east side of the intersection the street reduces to a two lane ?local street? with a designated left turn lane. The overall width of this street averages 50 feet. There are marked 7 foot wide bike lanes for north and southbound directions of travel and one bike lane for westbound travel.	The roadway surface was found to be dry, of an asphalt composition which appeared to be worn and polished otherwise in satisfactory condition. The east and westbound lanes of this intersection were uninvolved in this crash event.

The north side of the intersection was also uninvolved in this crash event. On the south side of the intersection the opposing lanes are separated by a four foot wide raised concrete median containing lowing lying surface vegetation. Along the south west and southeast portions of the intersection there are multi- unit apartment complexes.
The posted speed limit for north and southbound traffic is 40 mph. Both the north and south sides of this street are bordered by raised concrete curbs and sidewalks.
MC1 was a red/white 2007 Suzuki GSXR 599cc (sport race replica style) motorcycle being operated by a 22 year old male rider. The rider was wearing an unknown Shoei RF-1100 full face DOT approved and Snell M2010 rated motorcycle helmet at the time of the crash. There were no passengers on the motorcycle.
The rider was travelling eastbound in a designate ?right turn only? lane approaching the intersection. The rider had just left his place of employment and was slowing to turn right (southbound) at the intersection. The rider told me that as he came out of the turn he was transitioning from the SB #3 lane to the #2 lane
 
with the intent to enter the #1 lane. During this left lane change the rider said his rear tire lost traction while crossing over a lane reflector causing the rear tire to slide out to the left. The rider told me his immediate reaction was to apply his front brake and counter steer to the left. The rider freely admitted that this had been the wrong decision on how to come out of the slide. The rider?s move caused the motorcycle to ?high side? left and ejecting him.
The rider said he slid about 20 feet before coming to rest adjacent to the raised center median. The motorcycle continued a short distance before it collapsed on to the roadway surface sliding another 20 feet before coming to rest left side down.
RiderInj: The 22 year old male rider of MC1 sustained non-life threatening injuries as a result of the collision. The injuries sustained were a sprained left ankle and left wrist fracture. He also sustained numerous surface abrasions to his knees, elbows and shoulder. The rider had no internal injuries. There were no objective symptoms of alcohol intoxication or drug use.
Human: The 22 year old male rider of MC1 made a decision to apply his front brake and counter steer left in an attempt to gain control of the slide out and subsequently lost control of his motorcycle, causing it to ?high side? and eject him.
Vehicle:
MC1 sustained minor left side damage to the fairing, side covers, shift and clutch levers. MC1 appeared to have been in satisfactory operating condition prior to the crash.
There were no ?other vehicles? involved.
Environmental: There were no environmental factors that were determined to have contributed to the cause or outcome of this crash event.

CrashType: Motorcycle vs. SUV
Crash:
This two-vehicle crash occurred in October 2013 at 1955 in Southern California.	It was night, lighted with overhead streetlights, clear, the temperature was approximately 65 degrees F and the winds were WSW at approximately 3.5 mph. The asphalt roadway surface was dry, noted to be in travel worn, and there was light traffic.

The crash occurred in a residential area with apartments on both sides of the north/south divided road. There are 2 through lanes in each direction and a northbound left turn lane. The roadway is divided by a raised 15 ft. wide center median with trees and plants.	The speed limit is 45 mph, the southbound grade is -2.7% with a +4.0% crown.
MC1 is a 2013 Suzuki GSXR1000 (999cc) motorcycle ridden by a male rider of unknown age. The rider was wearing an unknown make/model of helmet. OV1 is a 2006 Chevrolet Trailblazer driven by a female of unknown age.	The driver of OV1 was reportedly wearing the available three-point manual lap and shoulder restraints.

MC1 was involved in a police pursuit for approximately 2 miles before slowing for a red traffic signal while traveling southbound in the #2 lane.	As the signal phased green, MC1 accelerated through the intersection to approximately 50 mph, overtaking OV1 in the #2 lane, with the intention of passing on the right.
The driver of OV1 observed the approaching police vehicle?s emergency lights/siren, slowed to approximately 8 mph, and started moving to the right shoulder to yield the right-of-way.	MC1 started to pass OV1 as OV1 was moving to the right shoulder. OV1?s right rear fender struck MC1 approximately 195 ft. south of
the south curb-line and 7 ft. east of the west curb-line.	MC1 angled right impacting the curb approximately 209 ft. south of the south curb-line. It then tumbled and slid along the grass to approximately 230 ft. south of the south curb-line and 6 ft. west of the west curb-line.	MC1 changed direction and moved
southeast to its ?Final Rest Position? (FRP) at approximately 244 ft. south of the south curb-line and 5 ft. east of the west curb-line, facing northbound on its
left side.	The rider of MC1 was ejected from MC1 when MC1 struck the west curb-line and came to rest at his FRP, 215 ft. south of the south curb-line and 6 ft. west of the west curb-line.	OV1 rolled on its wheels to its unknown FRP.
RiderInj: The unknown male rider of MC1 sustained the following injuries as related on the police report:broken left hand, bruised clavicle and abrasions to his left leg.	The Injury Severity Score (ISS) was 5.
ODriverInj: The driver of OV1 was not injured and alcohol was not a factor in the crash.
Human: The rider of MC1?s decision to pass OV1 on the right at a high rate of speed was a major causal factor in this crash.
Vehicle: There were no vehicle crash causation factors.
Environmental: There were no environmental crash causation factors.

CrashType: MC1 was making a right turn in a residential area when it lost friction with the roadway due to water and alga in the gutter. MC1 went down on its right side plane. The rider was not ejected.	MC1 had no passenger.
Crash:
This is a single MC crash in which MC1 lost traction with the roadway surface while making a slow speed right turn in a residential area. The traction was lost due to a wet surface with an undetermined type of algae growing in standing water. MC1 went onto its right side plane and slid to its FRP. The rider stayed in a seated position on MC1 and was not ejected. His right leg was pinned between MC1 and the roadway. He could not extricate himself from under the motorcycle. MC1 slid for approximately 5? feet before coming to rest. The crash took place at a ?T? type intersection on a local street with no signal controls.
There were no pre or post-impact tire marks. MC1 slid front end first. The roadway is an undivided two way road with no lane markings. The roadway has a right curve on the approach to the crash site and is level. The curve has a 1251? radius with a total length of 595?.	The mid-ordinate on a 100? chord was 13?. The posted speed limit is 25 mph. The roadway is made of an asphalt composition, is worn and polished, with some cracking, but otherwise in good condition. The crash occurred on a concrete gutter-way between the asphalt roadways. The gutter-way has some cracks, is worn and polished, but otherwise in good condition. The roadway is flat and level with a grade +0.2% and a +1.7% crown. The roadway has a north/south dedication, but is in a northeast/southwest orientation at the crash site. On-street parking is allowed on both sides of the roadway. There are no permanent visual obstructions that would be considered contributory to the crash. The crash occurred in Southern California in October of 2013 at 1303 hrs. The weather was cloudy/partly cloudy with a temperature of +68 degrees F. The wind was moderate from the southwest. Traffic conditions were light. The rider was not ejected and sustained moderate injuries.

MC1 was 2005 Honda VTX 1300 C cruising type motorcycle that was being operated by a 48 year old male (6? 02?/185 lbs.). The rider said he had just gone to a nearby gas station when he realized that he had left his wallet at home. He was returning home to retrieve his wallet when he crashed. Based on where the rider?s home is in relation to the crash site, the rider was not making a full 90 degree right turn. The rider has lived at this location for many years. He stated that there is always water run-off from his neighbor?s sprinklers that does not flow away to the storm drains. He stated that alga grows in the standing water and that he has almost ?spun out? in his car while driving to and from his house. Alga was observed and photographed during the scene inspection. Alga was found wherever standing water was located. He stated that he was going about 15 mph and had a slight lean into the turn when the front and rear tires
 
washed out from underneath him. He stated that he remained on and under MC1 to the FRP. The rider has had no formal training and did not possess a motorcycle endorsed license. The loss of traction occurred so quickly that the rider had no opportunity to attempt any collision avoidance maneuvers. The rider was not wearing any protective apparel other than a helmet. Had he worn more than a t-shirt, shorts, and athletic shoes, he may not have sustained some of the more minor injuries. It is doubtful that protective apparel would have prevented the more serious injuries that were sustained. The rider was treated at the scene and taken to a local hospital where he was admitted and hospitalized for five days. MC1 was put into the rider?s garage. The key to MC1 was lost or misplaced
RiderInj: The 48 year old male operator of MC1 sustained moderate injuries consisting of 4 rib fractures on the right side, a fractured clavicle, and some abrasions and contusions. The rider of MC1 showed no signs of impairment that would otherwise inhibit his ability to operate a motor vehicle.
Human: The rider of MC1 had a decision failure in riding too fast through a known dangerous water hazard.
Vehicle: MC1 sustained minor damage to the front to the right side as a result of landing and sliding on its right side plane. The damage consisted of mostly minor scrapes and nothing was broken. There was no reduction in wheelbase. The pre-crash condition would be labeled as very good.
Environmental: The level street and gutter does not provide enough grade for nominal amounts of water to flow away and dry out. The standing water allows alga to grow and create a hazardous situation.

CrashType: MC1 was making a left turn from a stop sign in a residential area when he lost control and impacted a parked vehicle. MC1 went down on its left side plane. The rider was fully ejected.	MC1 had no passenger.
Crash:
This is a MC crash in which MC1 impacted a legally parked and unoccupied vehicle. MC1 side-swiped OV1 impacting it in the left-rear side at the wheel. MC1 then went down on its left side plane. The crash took place just north of a four-way, not skewed, intersection on a local street with stop signs in all directions. There were no pre or post-impact tire marks. MC1 slid front end first on its left side plane. The roadway is an un-divided two way road with painted lane markings. The roadway is straight and is made of an asphalt composition, is worn and polished, but otherwise in good condition. The roadway is flat and level with a grade of +1.2% and a +5.5% crown. The roadway has a north/south dedication, but is in a northeast/southwest orientation at the crash site. On-street parking is allowed on both sides of the roadway. There are no permanent visual obstructions that would be considered contributory to the crash. The posted speed limit is 25 mph. The crash occurred in Southern California in October of 2013 at 1212 hrs. The weather was clear with a temperature of +67 degrees F. The wind was light from the southwest. Traffic conditions were light. The rider was ejected and sustained minor injuries

The rider of MC1 was wearing an unknown style helmet with unknown safety ratings. It is unknown what, if any, other safety equipment he was wearing.

MC1 was 2004 Harley Davidson Fat Boy cruising type motorcycle that was being operated by a 45 year old male (6? 03?/220 lbs.). The rider said that he was making a left turn and lost control. He then hit the parked truck. The rider was found to have a suspended license. The suspension bacame effective the date of the crash and was for driving under the influence of alcohol/drugs. He was also found to not have a motorcycle endorsement. The roadway was free and clear of any fluids or debris that would have caused the rider to lose control. The rider was found on his back near his motorcycle. A small pool of blood was
found in the roadway at the crash scene. Blood was also found in the area of the right handgrip on MC1. See photos # 0270MC41 and 42. It is unknown whether the rider ever had a motorcycle endorsement on his license or any formal training.
RiderInj: The 45 year old male operator of MC1 sustained minor injuries consisting of facial abrasions and lacerations. The rider of MC1 showed no signs of impairment that would otherwise inhibit his ability to operate a motor vehicle.
Human: The rider of MC1 had a reaction failure in riding too wide while making a left turn.
Vehicle: MC1 sustained minor damage to the front fender and to the right side as a result of impacting OV1. MC1 also sustained minor damage to its left side after falling onto the roadway on its left side plane. The damage consisted of mostly minor scrapes however; the right footboard and brake pedal were severely bent. There was no reduction in wheelbase. The pre-crash condition would be labeled as very good.
Environmental: There are no environmental factors considered to be contributory to this crash.

CrashType: Motorcycle vs. Automobile
Crash:
This two-vehicle crash occurred in November 2013 at 1105 hours in Southern California. It was daylight, clear, the temperature was approximately 77 degrees F and the winds were approximately 8.1 mph out of the SSW. The asphalt roadway surface was dry, noted to be travel worn, and there was light traffic.

The crash occurred on the southern leg of a Y-intersection with a northbound 2 lane street connecting on the north side. The south leg is a one-way eastbound roadway with a speed limit of 35 mph and a downhill grade of 2.5 % and a left downhill sloping 0.5% crown.	There are 2 through lanes, a left turn lane at the limit line for northbound travel and a left turn transition lane to the westbound northern leg of the Y.	No other legs of the intersection were involved in the accident. The roadway has a right curve that is 560 ft. long and a radius of 1111 ft.
MC1 is a 2011 Harley Davidson FLSTC (1584cc) Cruiser style motorcycle ridden by a 41 year old male (5 ft. 7 in. and 175 lbs.) rider with a 40 year old female (5 ft. 5 in. and 130 lbs.) passenger seated directly behind him. The rider was wearing a DOT approved, HCI, HCI-105-PCF half-helmet. The passenger was wearing a DOT approved, HJC, IS-2 half-helmet with an internal drop-down visor. OV1 is a 2008 BMW 128i Coupe driven by a 39 year old female (5 ft. 3 in. and 110 lbs.). The driver of OV1 was reportedly wearing the available three-point manual lap and shoulder restraints.

MC1 was traveling eastbound in the #1 lane, stopped at the limit line with a red phased signal waiting to proceed through the intersection. OV1 was eastbound in the #1 approaching the intersection at approximately 35 mph and was distracted while texting and failed to see MC1 until there was insufficient time to stop safely. OV1 braked and struck MC1 in the rear, below the taillight and pushed MC1 into the intersection. MC1?s passenger was ejected to the
right and came to rest beyond the crosswalk between the #1 and 2 lanes facing west.	MC1 and the rider pivoted right and came to rest on their left side in the #2 lane facing west just east of the limit line.
RiderInj: The 41 year-old male rider of MC1 sustained the following injuries as related during the interview:	abrasions to right elbow and right knee.	The Injury Severity Score (ISS) was 1. The 40 year-old female passenger of MC1 sustained the following injuries as related during the interview and from the medical record: posterior head contusion, posterior neck contusion, mid back strain, right elbow abrasions, anterior abdominal contusion, right buttocks contusion and left knee contusion and sprain.	The Injury Severity Score (ISS) was 3.
ODriverInj: The 39 year-old female driver of OV1 was uninjured. Alcohol was not a factor in this crash.
Human: The 39 year-old female driver of OV1 failed to perceive the red signal due to texting.
Vehicle: There were no vehicle crash causation factors.
Environmental: There were no environmental crash causation factors.

CrashType: Motorcycle (MC1) ridden by DUI rider passes a vehicle then lane changes to the left and rear ends OV1. Rider is fully ejected and sustains injuries. MC1 had no passenger.
Crash:
This crash occurred on a non-freeway major arterial just past an at-grade four-way type intersection with stop signs for the cross street. The roadway has an east/west designation and is in that orientation. The roadway has 3 through lanes in each direction, bike lanes, and dedicated left turn lanes. There is a curb high raised center divider. The roadside has 7? sidewalks and block walls. No on-street parking is allowed. MC1 was eastbound when the rider made two lane changes from the #1 lane to the #2 lane, and then back to the #1 lane while passing a vehicle and negotiating a right curve, then rear ended OV1 in the #1 lane. OV1 had just made a southbound to eastbound left turn and was in the #1 lane. The roadway is straight east of the intersection where the crash occurred. The rider had just left a nearby bar and was on his way home. MC1 left approximately 14? of locked rear wheel skid prior to impact. MC1 impacted OV1 in the center-rear with its right front fork, then the exhaust pipes. MC1 then went down on its left side plane. The rider was fully ejected and slid/skidded an unknown distance to his FRP next to the center divider.	Both sides of the roadway have medium density apartment type residences. The roadway is straight and level at the crash site with a 1.6% upgrade and 4.9% crown. The rider had navigated a right curve prior to the intersection. The curve had a radius is 626?.
The length of curve was measured at 350?. The posted speed limit is 45 mph. The cross street is a two lane undivided local road with on-street parallel parking. It is straight and has a 5.6% upgrade on the approach with a 4.2% crown. The posted speed limit is 25 mph.	There are no permanent visual obstructions that would be considered contributory to the crash. The roadway is made of an asphalt composition, and is worn and polished. It has a few tar snakes, but is in otherwise good condition. The crash occurred in Southern California in November of 2013 at 1738 hrs. It was dark with spot illumination. The weather was partly cloudy with a temperature of 63 degrees F. The wind was light from the SSW. Traffic conditions were moderate. The rider sustained minor injuries. MC1 had no reduction in wheelbase. MC1 was towed. OV1 was driven away.

MC1 was a 2013 Harley Davidson Sportster chopper/modified chopper style motorcycle that was being operated by a 28 year old male (6? 02?/234 lbs.). He was wearing an unknown style helmet with unknown safety ratings. It is unknown if the helmet was retained on the riders head to the end of the crash event.
 
The rider stated that he had just left a bar with some friends and made a left turn onto the east/west roadway. The 30 year old female driver of OV1 said that she was southbound and was stopped at the stop sign. She could see that traffic was stopped west of her at the signal one block away. She made her left turn and was eastbound in the #1 lane when she could hear a loud motorcycle but could not see it. She then felt an impact from behind. The rider of MC1 initially was behind his friends from the bar. They were both eastbound in the #1 lane after making a left turn. It was when he decided to pass his friends and change lanes back to the #1 lane that the crash occurred. The rider of MC1 made multiple lane changes to get ahead of his friends and lead them to his residence that was a couple blocks away. After making a lane change from the #1 lane to the #2 lane and then back to the #1 lane, MC1 rear-ended OV1. MC1 left approximately 14? of rear tire skid prior to impacting OV1. After impacting OV1, MC1 went down on its left side plane and slid approximately 47? to its FRP. MC1 impacted the raised center divider at or near its FRP. Witnesses (rider?s friends) said that the rider appeared distracted as he made his lane changes. The
rider was treated at the scene and taken to a local hospital where he was treated and released, then taken into custody for DUI.
RiderInj: The 28 year old male operator of MC1 sustained minor injuries consisting of abrasions to his arms and legs. It is unknown if the rider was wearing any protective apparel and whether or not it prevented/reduced any injuries. The rider of MC1 was legally impaired and arrested for DUI.
ODriverInj: The driver of OV1 was not injured. She showed no signs of impairment.
Human: The rider of MC1 had a decision error in riding while intoxicated. The cause of the crash was a perception error on the part of the rider.
Vehicle:
MC1 sustained moderate damage consisting of damaged exhaust pipes, shifter, rear brake lever, foot pegs, and scratches. There was no reduction in wheelbase. The pre-crash condition would be labeled as new.

OV1 was not inspected. Damage was listed as minor in the accident report and the vehicle was driven away. The pre-crash and post-crash condition of OV1 is unknown.
Environmental: There were no environmental factors that were contributory to this crash.

CrashType: This was a motorcycle (MC1) vs. another vehicle (OV1) traffic collision with a secondary lay-down event that caused the motorcycle to impact the roadway surface ejecting the rider causing major injuries.
MV1: 2005 Yamaha YZF R6 (sport race replica) 600cc, blue in color
OV1: 1999 Lexus LX470 (Sport Utility Vehicle) green in color
Crash:
This was a motorcycle vs. other vehicle head on type traffic collision resulting in major injuries to the motorcycle rider. The collision occurred on Tuesday, November 2013 at 0803 hours in Southern California. The weather report for 0758 hours indicated clear skies, with calm winds and an ambient temperature of 56.1 degrees F. Visibility at ground level was clear and unobstructed in all directions. The roadway surface for MC1 had a +2.8 uphill grade with a 4.3% crown. The roadway surface was found to be dry of an asphalt composition which appeared to be worn and polished otherwise in satisfactory condition. There were no super-elevation issues with this roadway.
The collision occurred at an ?at grade? T-intersection of a minor arterial surface street with an overall travel-way width of 64 feet. For both MC1 and OV1 the roadway is straight approaching the intersection. The roadway runs north and southbound with two lanes dedicated for northbound and two lanes dedicated for southbound traffic. The north and southbound through lanes are separated by a painted 10 foot wide two way left turn lane open to both directions of travel.

There are no traffic signals or devices to regulate both north and southbound traffic into the intersecting public driveway. This driveway allows access into the parking area of a local public school.
South of this driveway and along the east side of the street there is an intersecting local street approximately 40 feet in width. This street runs east and west allowing access into commercial and residential areas.	The north and southbound lanes of the minor arterial street are not regulated by any posted or marked traffic control devices other than the post 40 mph speed limit signs. The east and westbound lanes of the intersecting local street are regulated by a posted and marked stop sign at the intersection.	There is no posted speed regulation for the intersecting driveway into the local school parking lot.
The minor arterial roadway is also bordered on the both sides by raised concrete curbs and adjoining concrete sidewalks.	There are no unusual surface features and the east side of the street is occupied by both single story commercial and single family residential structures.
MC1 was a 2005 Yamaha YZF R6 (sport race replica) style motorcycle being operated by a 31 year old male rider.	The rider was travelling at a speed of about
 
40 mph, southbound in the #1 lane of the minor arterial surface street approaching the intersection. There were no other vehicles in the area other than OV1. OV1 was a 1999 Lexus LX470 (sport utility vehicle) being operated by a 45 year old female. OV1was approaching the intersection northbound in the two way left turn lane slowing and preparing for an intended left turn movement into the high school parking lot.

The driver of OV1 did not stop prior to her turn, and continued her left turn at a speed of about 5 mph.	As the driver crossed the southbound #1 lane she felt a sudden impact to the front of her vehicle, stopped for a few seconds and proceeded into the parking lot driveway. When the driver exited her vehicle she noticed the crashed motorcycle in the street and the rider, laying on the sidewalk area adjacent to the driveway.
The rider apparently had noticed OV1 making the left turn however had no time to initiate a collision avoidance maneuver.	MC1 struck OV1 in the front center portion of the bumper and grille.
The resulting impact caused the rider to vault over the left front quarter panel of OV1 and he vaulted across the roadway surface. The rider impacted onto the adjacent (west side) sidewalk and planter area approximately 40 feet 6 inches from the area of impact.
MC1 collapsed right side down on to the roadway surface being pushed back approximately 6 feet 8 inches and 9 feet off set (right) from the area of impact. The rider had been removed from the scene prior to our arrival.
At the time of the collision there were no other vehicles, pedestrians, or animals that caused or contributed to the event.
RiderInj: The 30 year old rider of MC1 sustained fractures to both arms and both legs as well as a laceration to his penis. He was treated at the scene and subsequently transported to a local hospital where he was admitted for treatment. The rider of MC1 had no objective symptoms of drug and/or alcohol use at the time of the crash.
ODriverInj: The driver and passenger of OV1 sustained no injuries and there was no indication of drug and/or alcohol involvement. The driver claimed a neurological disorder from mercury exposure. She submitted a voluntary blood sample which came back negative for drug and/or alcohol use.
Human: The rider of MC1 could not sufficiently react in time due to the proximity and position of OV1 to initiate a collision avoidance maneuver. The driver of OV1 made an unsafe decision to turn having failed to notice the presence of MC1 while making her left turn movement.
Vehicle:
MC1 sustained major to front end damage as a result of impacting OV1 however appeared to have been in satisfactory operating condition prior to the crash event.
The reduction in wheel base could not be accurately measured not only to the collapsing of the forks but the extensive damage to the frame in the area of the yolk. In this area the frame broke apart causing a separation of the front tire and forks from the body of the frame. MC1 appeared to have been in satisfactory operating condition prior to the crash event.
OV1 sustained moderate front end damage however, appeared to have been in satisfactory operating condition prior to the crash event.
Environmental: There were no environmental conditions that contributed to the cause or outcome of this crash event.

CrashType: Motorcycle vs. Raised curb
Crash:
This single motorcycle crash occurred in November 2013 at 1006 in Southern California.	It was daylight and mostly cloudy. The temperature was approximately 67 degrees F and the winds were ENE at approximately 8 mph. The asphalt roadway surface was dry, noted to be travel worn with tar snakes.There was light traffic.
The crash occurred on a north/south divided roadway with an uphill grade of 0.3%, a crown of 2.4% and a right hand curve; that is 377 ft. in length and has a radius of 1250.5 ft. There are 2 northbound travel lanes and 2 southbound travel lanes and a bicycle lane, divided by a 16 ft. wide raised center median, covered with grass, shrubs and trees.	To the east and west are residential apartments.	There are no traffic controls.	The reference point (RP) is an overhead light pole which is 3 ft. east of the west curb of the center median and approximately 101 ft. south of the Point of Impact (POI).
MC1 is a 1999 Yamaha YZF R-6 (599cc) sport motorcycle ridden by a 41 year old male (5 ft. 9 in. and 145 lbs.) rider. The rider was wearing a full- face Bilt helmet, manufactured in 2011, with FMVSS 218 and UN/ECE-22-05 conformity ratings. MC1 was southbound in the #1 lane, at a high rate of speed.
MC1 failed to negotiate the curve, struck the center median approximately 101 ft. north of RP. MC1 and rider slid along and on the center median, until the rider struck the RP.	The riders Point of Rest (POR) was approximately 98 ft. south of the POI. MC1 continued along the edge of the center median approximately another 100 ft. from the RP to its POR.
The reason MC1 struck the center median is unknown, alcohol was deemed not to be a factor.
RiderInj: The 41 year-old male rider of MC1 sustained the following injuries as related on the medical examiner?s report. Skeletal injuries: bilateral skull, rib, forearm and femur fractures. Sternum, right humerus and left 1st metacarpal fractures. Internal injuries:	 Subpleural and intraparenchymal lung, bilateral subarachnoid brain and intraparenchymal thyroid hemorrhages; thyroid and bilateral pulmonary contusions; bilateral hemothorax, ruptured stomach, gallbladder avulsion; lacerations to the spleen, liver and liver intraparenchymal pulpifaction. Soft tissue injuries: right thumbnail avulsion; multiple abrasions and contusions of the anterior and posterior body.
Human: The 41 year-old male rider of MC1 failed to negotiate the right curve, reason unknown, but alcohol was not a factor.
Vehicle: There were no vehicle crash causation factors.
Environmental: There were no environmental crash causation factors.

CrashType: This was a motorcycle (MC1) vs. roadway surface, low side left lay down crash event with a secondary impact of another vehicle (OV1). The rear portion of MC1 impacted with the left front tire and quarter panel of OV1. The rider of MC1 sustained a critical head injury as a result of the multiple impacts with the roadway surface and the under carriage of OV1.
MV1: 2007 Harley Davidson FLHP Road King (1690cc), black
Crash:
This was a motorcycle vs. other vehicle injury traffic collision. The collision occurred on Saturday, November 2013 at 1642 hours in Southern California. The weather report for 1653 hours showed scattered clouds, southwest wind direction at 5.8 mph and an ambient temperature of 66.0 degrees F. Visibility was
10.0 miles clear and unobstructed for all directions of travel. On approach to the intersection the roadway surface for the motorcycle (MC1) had a +2.4% grade with a +0.9% crown. The roadway surface was found to be of an asphalt composition which appeared to be worn and polished otherwise in satisfactory condition. There were no super-elevation issues with this roadway.
The collision occurred at an ?at grade? four way intersection of a minor arterial	surface street with an overall travel-way width of 65 feet. The posted speed limit for both directions of travel is 40 mph. The roadway is straight and runs east and west with two through lanes dedicated for both directions of travel.
On both sides of the intersection there are designated left turn lanes allowing east to north and to west to south movement of traffic through the intersection. The left turn lanes are marked by painted left turn arrows on the roadway surface.
The local street intersecting south of the intersection allows for ingress and egress of traffic to and from a multiple family unit apartment complex. The traffic control devices at this intersection are a posted stop sign with painted stop line for northbound traffic on the approach.
The intersecting local street north of the intersection allows for ingress and egress to a multiple commercial business complex and has a painted stop line on the approach for southbound traffic. The speed on both these cross streets is regulated at a maximum 25 mph. These streets are approximately 40 feet in width with one lane for north and one lane for southbound traffic.
MC1 was a 2007 Harley Davidson Road King (cruiser style) motorcycle being operated by a 30 year old male rider.	The rider was traveling the wrong way westbound in the eastbound #2 lane approaching the intersection at an approximate speed of 40 mph.
OV1 was a 2001 Ford Expedition (SUV) being operated by 38 year old male driver. The vehicle was also occupied by the drivers spouse and three children. The driver of OV1 was traveling westbound on the minor arterial roadway approaching the intersection and had entered the designated left turn lane to go south into the apartment complex where he lives.
The driver of OV1 brought his vehicle to a complete stop prior to making his left turn making sure there was no approaching eastbound traffic in proximity of his location. The driver had no idea or prior warning of the presence of MC1 approaching his location from the wrong direction.
Satisfied that it was clear to make his turn, the driver of OV1 move his vehicle from the left turn lane moving south while crossing the eastbound lanes of the minor arterial roadway. The driver still had no knowledge of the presence of MC1 until he felt an impact of his vehicle in the area of the left front quarter panel as he was crossing the eastbound #2 lane.
The driver immediately stopped his vehicle and discovered the rider of MC1 wedged underneath the left side of the SUV and the motorcycle down on it?s left side some distance ahead.
RiderInj: The 30 year old male rider of MC1 sustained a critical head injury as a result of the collision. The rider?s injuries were described as blunt force trauma to the head with petechial hemorrhaging of the right frontal lobe. The unconscious rider was treated at the scene and subsequently transported to a hospital where he was admitted for treatment. The rider remained hospitalized for a period of 12 days until moved to a rehabilitation facility for continued therapy. The attending physician rated the rider?s extent of coma on the Glasgow Coma Scale as a 9. There was no alcohol/drug test administered or documented by law enforcement or hospital staff.
ODriverInj: The 38 year old male driver and the occupants of OV1 were uninjured.
Human:
The 30 year old male rider of MC1 was operating his motorcycle on the wrong side of the roadway and taking unnecessary risks with respect to other traffic on the roadway.
The 38 year old male driver of OV1 was proceeding at a safe speed abiding by traffic regulations and did not contribute anything to the cause or outcome of this crash event.
Vehicle:
MC1 sustained major left side and rear end damage as a result of impacting the roadway surface and OV1. MC1 appeared to have been in satisfactory operating condition prior to the crash event.
OV1 sustained minor left side damage to the left front tire and quarter panel however, appeared to have been in satisfactory operating condition prior to the crash event.
Environmental: There were no environmental factors that were determined to have contributed to the cause or outcome of this crash event.

CrashType: Motorcycle vs. Automobile
Crash:
This two-vehicle crash occurred in November 2013 at 1923 in Southern California.	It was night/lighted, clear, the temperature was approximately 59 degrees F and the winds were calm. The asphalt roadway surface was dry, noted to be in good condition, and there was light traffic.

The crash occurred in a commercial area, on the northbound side of a north/south divided state highway. There are 4 through lanes in each direction and a
left turn lane, which opens at the ?Point of Impact? (POI).	The roadway is divided by a raised 15 ft. wide center median with trees and plants.	The speed limit is 45 mph, the northbound grade is +0.8 % with a +6.6% crown.
MC1 is a 2012 Honda CBR1000RR (998cc) motorcycle ridden by a 39 year old male (5 ft. 11 in. and 240 lbs.) rider. The rider was wearing a Shoei RF-1100 full-face helmet with a clear visor. OV1 is a 2004 Lexus ES330 driven by a 27 year old female (5 ft. 6 in. and 127 lbs.). The driver of OV1 was reportedly wearing the available three-point manual lap and shoulder restraints.

MC1 was traveling northbound in the #1 lane approaching the left turn pocket. OV1 was stopped, westbound in a commercial driveway prepared to make a right turn across the four lanes to enter the left turn pocket, which is approximately 75 ft. north of the driveway. The driveway is 42 ft. wide and 7 ft. north of the Reference Point (RP).	As MC1 neared the area of the driveway, the rider observed OV1 move into the # 4 lane then rapidly cross all lanes toward the entrance to the left turn pocket.	MC1 braked, leaving 19 ft. of rear wheel skid, before impacting the left rear door of OV1. ?Point of Impact #1? (POI #1) is approximately 135 ft. north and 18 ft. west of the RP.	The rider pushed away from OV1 and MC1, impacting the roadway with his helmet and side, then sliding and tumbling an unknown distance to his ?Final Rest Position? (FRP) in the left turn lane, near the center divider.	MC1 fell onto its right side at POI #2, approximately 134 ft. north and 40 ft. west of RP. MC1 slid northwest impacting and crossing the center divider POI #3, approximately 286 ft. north and 57 ft. west of RP and continued to its FRP approximately 364 ft. north and 56 ft. west of RP.	OV1 continued to its FRP approximately 375 ft. north and 48 ft. west of
RP. Driver stated she thought the roadway was clear, she never saw MC1. MC1 was unable to move to the right to try and avoid OV1 due to the nearness of an uninvolved OV.
RiderInj: The 39 year-old male rider of MC1 sustained the following injuries as related on the medical record and from the rider interview: right 4th metacarpal fracture, left lower 2nd molar fracture, lower lip laceration, left abdominal abrasions, bilateral knee abrasions and left elbow contusion. The Injury Severity Score (ISS) was 6.
ODriverInj: The driver of OV1 was not injured nor was alcohol a factor in the crash.
Human: The 27 year-old female driver of OV1 failed to perceive the approach of MC1 and her decision to cross all northbound traffic lanes without the proper time and distance were major causal factors in this crash.
Vehicle: There were no vehicle crash causation factors.
Environmental: There were no environmental crash causation factors.

CrashType: OV1 starts making left turn in front of MC1, and then stops blocking lanes. MC1 moves from the #2 lane to #1 lane in attempt to avoid crash but impacts right rear of OV1. Rider is fully ejected and sustains injuries. MC1 had no passenger.
Crash:
This crash occurred on a non-freeway major arterial at an at-grade four-way type intersection with signal controls. The roadway has an east/west designation but is in southwesterly/northeasterly orientation at the crash site. The roadway has 2 through lanes in each direction and dedicated left turn lanes. The left turn lanes are permissive turn full time. On the rider?s approach to the intersection, the roadway is divided by double yellow painted lines. On the OV driver?s approach, the roadway has a two-way left turn lane. The roadside has 11? sidewalks. On-street parking is allowed on both sides of the roadway. MC1 was westbound in the #2 lane when a vehicle made a left turn at the intersection. The OV was stopped behind that non-involved vehicle, then started to make a left turn. The rider changed lanes from the #2 lane to the #1 lane to go behind the OV. The OV then stopped in the middle of the intersection blocking both lanes. The rider had no time to react and impacted OV1 in the right rear side/bumper area. The rider was fully ejected and landed approximately 15? away in the #1 lane. MC1 fell on its right side plane and slid approximately 321? to its FRP where it impacted the curb. There were no pre-impact skids from either vehicle. The roadway is straight and has a slight downgrade of -2.6% for MC1 and a crown of 5.7%. Both sides of the roadway have office/commercial/retail businesses. There are no permanent visual obstructions that would be considered contributory to the crash. The roadway is made of an asphalt composition, worn and polished, but is in otherwise good condition. The posted speed limit is 40 mph. The crash occurred in Southern California in November of 2013 at 1318 hrs. The weather was overcast with a temperature of 64 degrees F. The wind was light from the SSW. Traffic conditions were moderate. The rider sustained moderate injuries. MC1 had no reduction in wheelbase. MC1 was towed. OV1 was driven away.

MC1 was a 2004 Kawasaki ZX12R sport/racing style motorcycle that was being operated by a 23 year old male (6? 00?/205 lbs.). MC1 was substantially modified. He was wearing an unknown style helmet with unknown safety ratings. It was reported by the police that the helmet was retained on the rider?s head to the end of the crash event.
 
The rider stated that he was traveling with the flow of traffic at about 40-45 mph when the OV pulled out for the left turn then stopped. He stated that he changed lanes to go around the rear of the OV but because it stopped he was unable to get around it and crashed. The 85 year old female (5?09?/162 lbs.) driver of OV1 said that she saw MC1 in the #1 lane passing a vehicle in the #2 lane. She stated that she had plenty of room to make her left turn. The driver of OV1 drove to the side of the road and parked after the crash. MC1 continued in a westbound direction for approximately 48? before falling onto its right side plane. MC1 then skidded/slid another 321? to its FRP. MC1 slid high side first then rotated CW to front end first. Using a coefficient of friction of 0.4 in a slide to stop calculation, MC1?s minimum speed would be 61.98 mph after impacting OV1. This speed is substantially higher than the posted speed limit of 40 mph.
Some witnesses said that MC1 was on fire while it was sliding down the road. There was no evidence of any fire when MC1 was inspected. The reported fire was possibly contact sparks from MC1 and the roadway. There was a fuel leak at MC1?s FRP that came from the gas cap area. MC1 was found to have low air pressure in both tires. The real tire was legally bald (no measurable tread). The rider was treated at the scene and taken to a local hospital where he was admitted for an unknown number of days.
RiderInj: The 23 year old male operator of MC1 sustained moderate injuries consisting of multiple fractures to his right hand (NFS) requiring several surgeries, and abrasions and contusions to his right knee and leg. It is unknown if the rider was wearing any protective apparel and whether or not it prevented/reduced any injuries.
ODriverInj: The driver of OV1 was not injured. She showed no signs of impairment.
Human: The driver of OV1 had a decision error in making the left turn in front of on-coming traffic. The rider also had a decision error in riding too fast. The cause of the crash was a decision error on the part of the driver of OV1.
Vehicle:
MC1 sustained major damage consisting of damaged fairing, headlights, cooling system, engine and transmission cases, exhaust pipe, foot pegs, handlebars, levers, mirrors, and a crack in the frame (see picture 0279MC29). This was not visible during inspection due to the battery cover/plate that was still installed. The repair facility provided this picture. There was no reduction in wheelbase. The pre-crash condition would be labeled as very good.

OV1 was not inspected. It was present at the scene, but left before photographs could be taken. Damage was listed as minor in the accident report and the vehicle was driven away. The pre-crash and post-crash condition of OV1 is unknown.
Environmental: There were no environmental factors that were contributory to this crash.

CrashType: The rider had experienced a mechanical problem with the throttle assembly which caused a rapid acceleration of the motorcycle and subsequently ejected the rider on to the roadway surface. The motorcycle continued without an operator until it impacted a street light and surface vegetation along a raised center median. The multiple impacts caused the motorcycle to collapse and slide to the side of the roadway a distance of approximately 1800 feet from where the rider had initially lost control and fell off. Rider sustained non-life threatening injuries. There were no passengers on the motorcycle or other vehicles involved.
MV1: 2008 Harley Davidson Road King FLHR (touring style) motorcycle (1573cc)
Crash:
This was a motorcycle vs. multiple fixed objects (street light, surface vegetation and roadway surface) front end and left side impact type traffic collision resulting in minor injuries to the motorcycle rider. The collision occurred on Saturday, November 2013 at 1108 hours in Southern California. The weather report showed clear skies, a west wind direction @ 4.6 mph, and an ambient temperature of +71.1 degrees F. The roadway surface was found to be dry of an asphalt composition which appeared to be worn and polished with longitudinal surface fracturing otherwise was in satisfactory condition. There was a measured 2.0% uphill grade in the area of the crash site.
The collision occurred on a straight multiple lane street with an overall travel-way width of 67 feet. This is a principal east/west arterial with three lanes dedicated for eastbound traffic and two lanes for westbound traffic. There is a four way signal controlled multi-lane intersection in the area but the north and southbound lanes were uninvolved in the crash event.
West of the intersection and adjacent to the westbound lanes is a 5 foot wide designated ?Bike Lane? that separates the through lanes of traffic with a marked parallel parking area. The east and westbound lanes are separated by a painted solid double yellow line.
At the location of the crash site there were traffic control devices to regulate the flow of traffic in all four directions at the intersection along with designated left turn lanes. There are also painted 12 foot wide pedestrian crosswalks at the intersection. There is a posted speed limit of 40 mph for east & westbound traffic. The street is bordered on both sides by raised concrete curbing and 8 foot wide concrete sidewalks. The area is occupied by both single and multiple family residential structures.
MC1 was a 2008 Harley Davidson Road King (Touring style) motorcycle being operated by a 35 year old male rider. The rider was wearing a Bell DOT FMVSS 218/Snell M2010 approved full face motorcycle helmet at the time of the crash. The helmet sustained surface abrasion type damage but remained secure on the riders head throughout the crash event.
The rider was travelling westbound in the #1 lane of the multi-lane surface street approaching the signal controlled intersection at a speed of approximately
 
45 mph. The rider noticed the signals for his direction of travel had begun to phase from green to yellow. He increased his speed in order to pass through the intersection before the red phase. As the rider moved through the intersection he attempted to back off on the throttle to decrease his speed. It was during this transition the rider told me the ?fly-by-wire? throttle malfunctioned causing it to ?go wide open?. MC1 rapidly accelerated beyond the rider?s control.
MC1 was equipped with 18 inch high rise style handlebars and the rider lost control of his grip during the rapid acceleration. This caused the rider to shift position from the rider?s seat, to the passenger seat and onto the rear fender. The rider then slid off the fender onto the roadway surface.
MC1 continued westbound another 1,800 feet passing through another signal controlled intersection before drifting towards the center of the roadway riding up onto a raised median striking an overhead concrete street light and surface vegetation.	MC1 finally collapsed onto the left side and slid to a stop adjacent to the north side of the roadway. No other vehicles or pedestrians came in contact with MC1.
RiderInj: The 35 year old male rider sustained minor injuries as a result of falling of his motorcycle. The injuries sustained were a broken right radius bone of the forearm, numerous abrasions to his back and arms, and laceration to the middle finger of the left hand.
Human: The rider was found to be properly licensed, insured and there was no evidence of alcohol and/or drug intoxication.
Vehicle: The motorcycle (MC1) sustained major front end and left side damage however, appeared to have been in satisfactory operating condition prior to the crash.
Environmental: There were no environmental factors that were determined to have contributed to the cause or outcome of this crash event.

CrashType: Motorcycle vs. Ground
Crash:
This single motorcycle crash occurred in December 2013 at 1830 in Southern California. It was night, clear, the temperature was approximately 60 degrees F and the winds were calm. The asphalt roadway surface was dry, noted to be travel worn with tar snakes and was illuminated by overhead spot lighting.

The crash occurred at a skewed T intersection, in a rural area. The east/west roadway is an undivided 2 lane road with a commercial business on the north side and fenced rural land on the south.	The lanes are 15 ft. wide, the westbound grade is -3.6% and the crown is 1.1%. There is a stop sign for westbound traffic. The north/south roadway forms the top of the T and is an undivided 2 lane road with a southbound left turn lane and bike lanes on both sides. The traffic lanes are 12 ft. wide and the bike lanes are 10 ft. wide. There are no traffic controls.
MC1 is a 2011 Harley Davidson FLHX (1584cc) motorcycle ridden by a 50 year old male (5 ft. 9 in. and 190 lbs.) rider. The rider was wearing an unknown make/model helmet. MC1 was traveling westbound approaching the intersection in the left turn lane. MC1 attempted to make a left turn onto the north/south roadway, but ran wide and fell on the ground approximately 2 ft. 6 in. south of the south curb-line and on the west curb-line. MC1 and the rider slid approximately 1 ft. south to their final rest position.
RiderInj: The 50 year-old male rider of MC1 sustained the following injuries as related on the police report and from the rider interview: laceration to nose and bilateral elbow abrasions. The Injury Severity Score (ISS) was 2.	The rider had a BAC of .22.
Human: The 50 year-old male rider of MC1 had a reaction failure due to a BAC of .22.
Vehicle: There was prior damage to MC1 which may have contributed to this crash.
Environmental: There were no environmental crash causation factors.

CrashType: Motorcycle riding in right lane over-brakes and goes down on left side plane when OV1 starts making a left turn in front of him from a stop sign. Rider is fully ejected and sustains injuries. MC1 had no passenger.
Crash:
This crash occurred on a non-freeway major arterial at an at-grade four-way, not skewed type intersection with stop signs for the cross street. The roadway has an east/west designation but is in a northeasterly/southwesterly orientation at the crash site. The roadway has 3 through lanes in each direction, dedicated left turn lanes, and a painted divider consisting of double-double solid yellow lines.	The roadside has 9? sidewalks and buildings on the right, a 6? sidewalk and block wall on the left. There are some trees on both sides of the roadway. No on-street parking is allowed. On the right is a commercial/retail center. On the left are medium density single family residences. The area was lit with overheard spot illumination. The roadway is straight and level with a
+0.3% upgrade and a +3.4% crown. MC1 was eastbound in the #3 curb lane when the OV started to make a left turn in front of him from the stop sign. The rider braked with both brakes, locking the rear and leaving a tire mark. The rider released the rear brake, and then over-braked with the front brake, locking it. This caused MC1 to lose control and high side onto its left side plane before impacting OV1. The rider was fully ejected. The posted speed limit is 50 mph. The cross street is a two lane undivided local road with on-street parallel parking. It is straight and has a +4.6% upgrade on the approach with a 1.8% crown. The posted speed limit is 25 mph.	There are no permanent visual obstructions that would be considered contributory to the crash. The roadway is made of an asphalt composition, and is worn and polished. The crash occurred in Southern California in December of 2013 at 1710 hrs.	The weather was cloudy/partly cloudy with a temperature of 60 degrees F. The wind was moderate from the SSW. Traffic conditions were moderate. MC1 had no reduction in wheelbase. Both MC1 and OV1 were towed.
MC1 was a 2004 Kawasaki Z1000 sport/racing type motorcycle with numerous modifications, including an extended rear double swing arm suspension assembly. It was being operated by a 38 year old male (6? 00?/215 lbs.). He was wearing a full face helmet with FMVSS 218 (US DOT) and UN/ECE-22-05 safety ratings. The helmet was retained on the rider?s head to the end of the crash event. The helmet sustained only minor freckles on the back side from when the rider laid his head onto the roadway.
The rider stated that he had just left the gym and was on his way home when the crash occurred. He stated that after making a right turn he thought that he had gone out to the #2 lane and was proceeding eastbound. As he approached the intersection, he saw OV1 stopped at the stop sign, when suddenly she pulled out in front of him making a left turn. He remembered braking and locking the rear wheel. He stated that he then impacted the OV and flew across the hood and landed in the street. He then remembered the OV rolling and he was beginning to get trapped under the tires. He was able to crawl away from the tires and the car stopped. The 20 year old female driver (5? 03?/127 lbs.) of OV1 said that she was northbound and was stopped at the stop sign. She stated that she had been at the stop sign for approximately 3 minutes waiting for traffic to clear. When she saw no cars on her side of the road, she pulled out and was impacted by MC1. She stated that she never saw MC1 and that he must have been speeding.	MC1 left approximately 31? of rear tire skid before leaving approximately 12? of front tire skid. There was an approximate 15? gap between skids. MC1 impacted OV1 at the left front tire area, causing the left front tire to go flat. There was minor denting to the left front side fender area. There were visible marks that appeared to be from the rider?s clothing across the hood of OV1. The rider was wearing a heavy leather jacket. The rider stated that he normally wears upper and lower protective gear along with boots; however, since he was only going to the gym a few miles away, he wore thin gym pants and athletic shoes. Based on the rear skid mark, it appears that MC1 attempted to veer left before braking. Although the skid mark is straight and approximately 32? long, it veers to the left.	There is approximately 15? of space before the second skid mark begins. The second skid mark is approximately 12? in length and veers to the right. It appears that the rider attempted to change directions after releasing the rear brake to avoid the crash, and then over-braked with the front brake, causing it to lock and high side MC1 onto its left side plane, high side first. MC1 left approximately 4? of scrapes before impacting OV1. MC1 rotated CW and impacted OV1. OV1 rolled from the POI to its FRP. The rider was treated at the scene and taken to a local hospital where he was admitted for 3 days.
RiderInj: The 38 year old male operator of MC1 sustained severe injuries consisting of bi-lateral hemothorax, fractures to the sternum, 2 posterior rib fractures, and the left proximal tibia/fibula. He also sustained torn ligaments in his right hand and knee. The left knee was sprained. There were bilateral contusions to the knees, as well as laceration to the right knee and an abrasion to the left knee.
ODriverInj: The driver of OV1 was not injured. She showed no signs of impairment.
Human: The driver of OV1 had a perception error.
Vehicle:
MC1 was extremely customized, including the paint job. There were very few original factory parts. The hand grips, brake/clutch levers, brakes, rotors, engine/transmission side cases, most lights, and rear swing arm were all custom after-market. The rear swing arm was elongated. The stock
wheelbase for the MC is 55.9?. MC1 had a measured wheelbase of nearly 62?.	MC1 sustained moderate damage consisting of a broken fairing, both side mirrors, instrument cluster, and damaged hand grips. There were numerous scratches and broken custom painted body parts.	The front forks, frame, and rear suspension all appeared undamaged. The left side engine guard was broken off. There was no reduction in wheelbase. The pre-crash condition would be labeled as very good.

OV1 sustained minor damage consisting of dents to the left front side and hood. The left front tire was flat as a result of the crash. There was pre-existing
 
minor damage to other areas of OV1.	The pre-crash condition of OV1 would be considered fair to good.
Environmental: There were no environmental factors that were contributory to this crash.

CrashType: Motorcycle vs. Automobile
Crash:
This two-vehicle crash occurred in December 2013 at 1114 in Southern California. It was daylight, partly cloudy, the temperature was approximately 76 degrees F and the winds were approximately 9 mph from the north. The asphalt roadway surface was dry, noted to be in good condition, and there was light traffic.

The crash occurred in a residential area, on a north/south undivided 2 lane roadway, at a 4 way intersection.	There are no traffic controls for north/south traffic.	On the southbound side there is a driveway for a residential park, on the northbound side there is an east/west, undivided 2 lane roadway with westbound traffic controlled by a stop sign and limit line. There are single family houses along the northbound side with trees/shrubs and a brick wall separation. he roadway is divided by a painted double yellow stripe.	The speed limit is 25 mph, the southbound grade is -1.8 % with a +2.0% crown.
MC1 is a 2005 Harley Davidson VRSCSE (1246cc) motorcycle ridden by a 57 year old male (6 ft. and 175 lbs.). The rider was wearing an HJC full- face helmet. OV1 is a 2005 Ford Focus driven by a 17 year old female (5 ft. 5 in. and 125 lbs.). The driver of OV1 was reportedly wearing the available three- point manual lap and shoulder restraints.

The Reference Point (RP) is a fire hydrant 52 ft. north of the north curb-line of the driveway and 2 ft. west of the west curb-line of the north/south roadway.

MC1 was traveling southbound intending to go through the intersection.	OV1 was westbound stopped at the limit line intending to make a left turn heading south.	Rider observed OV1 stopped and assumed it was safe to continue through the intersection; however, OV1 entered the intersection traveling approximately 52 ft. before striking MC1.	MC1 braked, leaving 38 ft. 4 in. of skid before being struck by OV1 on the left side.	The Point of Impact (POI) was approximately 64 ft. south and approximately 20 ft. east of the RP.	MC1 high-sided onto its right side, causing the rider to be ejected from MC1 and slide south/west into the curb face, approximately 39 ft., while MC1 slid approximately 45 ft. from the POI to its Final Rest Position (FRP), which was approximately 107 ft. south and approximately 7 ft. east of the RP.	OV1 rolled west approximately 23 ft. from the POI to its FRP, which was approximately 59 ft. south and
 
approximately 3 ft. west of the RP.
RiderInj:
The 57 year-old male rider of MC1 was riding with a broken left clavicle sustained in a motorcycle crash the week prior and sustained the following injuries as related on the emergency room record and interview:	right scaphoid fracture, right chipped olecranon, abrasion to spine of right scapula, abrasion and hematoma to right elbow, right gluteal hematoma and full length contusion of right outer leg.	The Injury Severity Score (ISS) was 5.
Alcohol was not a factor in this crash.
ODriverInj: The 17 year-old female driver of OV1 was not injured.
Human: OV1 driver?s failure to perceive the presence of MC1 is a major contributing causal factor.
Vehicle: There were no vehicle crash causal factors.
Environmental: There were no environmental crash causation factors.

CrashType: This was a motorcycle (MC1) low side left lay down event impacting the roadway surface including a secondary impact with another vehicle (OV1).	The motorcycle rider was ejected off the bike and sustained abrasions to his right hand and left knee. He also complained of pain to his back, chest, left hand and right wrist.	There were no passengers on this motorcycle at the time of the crash.
Crash:
This was a motorcycle vs. roadway surface vs. other vehicle left side to front impact type traffic collision resulting in minor injuries to the motorcycle rider. The collision occurred on Saturday, December 2013 at 1200 hours in Southern California. The weather report for 1156 hours showed clear skies, winds out of the west at 8.1 mph and, an ambient temperature of 70.0 degrees F. Visibility at ground level was 8.0 miles. The roadway surface was level, of an asphalt composition which appeared to be worn and polished otherwise in satisfactory condition. The collision occurred on a left curve multi-lane, minor arterial roadway of 298 feet in length with an overall travel-way width of 91feet. The radius of the roadway curvature was measured by using a 100? chord and was found to be approximately 626 feet on the approach to the intersection where the crash occurred. There were no super-elevation issues with this roadway.
This is an east/west surface street with three lanes dedicated for westbound traffic and two lanes for westbound traffic. There are also designated left and right turn only lanes for transition onto a local freeway system east of the crash location. The east and westbound lanes are separated by a 12 foot wide painted two-way left turn lane. There is a designated left turn lane for eastbound to northbound traffic onto a local street. There are no traffic signals at this intersection. The posted speed limit for east/west traffic is 35 mph.
This street is intersected by a north/south local street of approximately 24 feet in width. This street serves commercial businesses north of the crash location. There is one traffic regulation (posted stop sign) for southbound traffic. The speed limit is 25 mph.
The area of the collision scene is an ?at grade? intersection bordered by raised concrete curbs and sidewalks. There are also retail and commercial businesses on both the north and south sides of the street. There were no significant roadway grade or, crown issues with the roadway surface, in the area preceding, at or, beyond the crash site. There are no designated bicycle lanes or pedestrian crosswalks in the area of the crash site.
The case vehicle (MC1) was a 2004 Suzuki GSX-R 1000 (sport race replica) motorcycle being operated by a 22 year old male rider.	The rider was travelling westbound in the #1 lane of the multi-lane surface street approaching the intersection.
The other vehicle (OV1) was a 2000 Jaguar XK8 automobile being operated by a 56 year old male driver. The driver of OV1 had been travelling southbound on the local street and had stopped at the marked limit line prior to entering the intersection.
 
The driver of OV1 first looked to his left; checking for any approaching westbound traffic then looked to his right; waiting for one eastbound vehicle to pass. The driver accelerated into the intersection initiating a left turn movement. As he was crossing the westbound lanes his passenger said ?watch out?! The driver turned his attention to his left to see MC1 approaching in the westbound #1 lane and stopped his vehicle. OV1 had traveled about 60 feet. The driver saw the rider lay his motorcycle down in an attempt to avoid colliding with his vehicle. The motorcycle collapsed onto the roadway surface left side down
sliding into the left side of OV1 near the front portion of the driver side door. MC1 glanced off OV1 coming to rest in the #2 westbound lane left side down facing west. The rider fell off the motorcycle prior to impacting with OV1.
The rider of MC1 said that prior to the crash event he was traveling at a speed of about 15-20 mph. When he saw OV1 pull across his lane of travel his first instinct was to use his front brake and disengage his clutch however, he decided o lay the bike down and possibly avoid hitting OV1 along with the motorcycle.
At the time of the collision there were no other vehicles, pedestrians, animals or, environmental conditions that caused or contributed to the event.
RiderInj:
The rider of MC1 sustained minor injuries as a result of the collision. The injuries sustained were abrasions to the right hand and left knee. He also
complained of pain to his chest, back, left hand and right wrist. The police report indicated that there was no presence of alcohol or drugs in the rider?s system.
ODriverInj: The driver and passenger were not injured as a result of the collision. The police report also indicated that there were no apparent objective symptoms of alcohol or drug intoxication as well.
Human:
The 22 year old male rider of MC1 was driving at a speed considered safe for the present traffic on the roadway.
The 56 year old male driver of OV1 failed to yield to approaching traffic while entering the intersection from another local surface street.
Vehicle:
The motorcycle (MC1) sustained moderate front and left side damage however, appeared to have been in satisfactory operating condition prior to the collision.
The other vehicle (OV1) sustained minor left side damage otherwise, was in satisfactory operating condition prior to the collision.
Environmental: There were no environmental factors that were determined to have contributed to the cause or outcome of this crash event.

CrashType: Motorcycle vs. Automobile
Crash:
This two-vehicle crash occurred in December 2013 at 0930 in Southern California.	It was daylight, mostly cloudy, the temperature was approximately 68 degrees F and the winds were approximately 6 mph from the SSW. The concrete roadway surface was grooved, dry, travel worn and there was heavy/congested traffic.

The crash occurred on the northbound side of a north/south divided interstate highway, in a commercial area under a roadway overpass. There are no traffic controls present.	The northbound side has 6 through lanes, consisting of an HOV and 5 through lanes.	The north/south interstate highway is divided by a 3 ft. high concrete barrier.	The speed limit is 65 mph.
MC1 is a 2008 Suzuki GSXR1000 (999cc) motorcycle ridden by an unknown male (5 ft. 9 in. and 180 lbs.). The rider was reportedly wearing an unknown make and model helmet. OV1 is a 2004 Hyundai Sonata driven by an unknown male (6 ft. and 185 lbs.). The driver of OV1 was reportedly wearing the available three-point manual lap and shoulder restraints.

The Reference Point (RP) is the southern edge of the overpass and the center median. The Point of Impact #1 (POI) was approximately 53 ft. north and 16 ft. east of the RP.

MC1 was traveling northbound lane splitting between the #1 and 2 lanes at an estimated speed of 70-80 mph.	OV1 was northbound in the #1 lane, slowing for traffic, after merging right from the HOV lane. Rider looked down at his speedometer, when he looked back up, he observed OV1 slowing and attempted to brake and turn left to keep from hitting OV1. MC1 left a 4 ft. tire mark before the POI, then struck OV1 in the right rear. The rider was ejected from MC1 and came to rest approximately 120 ft. north of the RP at the center median.	MC1 came to rest approximately 90 ft. north and 14 ft. east of the RP.  OV1 moved to the center median, its location unknown.
RiderInj: The male rider of MC1 sustained the following injuries as related on the police report: Abrasions ?not further specified? to the lower back, left elbow, right hand, right knee and left foot. The Injury Severity Score (ISS) was 1. Alcohol was not a factor in this crash.
ODriverInj: The male driver of OV1 was not injured.
Human: MC1 rider was lane splitting at a high rate of speed in heavy traffic and failed to properly scan for traffic.
Vehicle: MC1 had a bald front tire that contributed to this crash.
Environmental: There were no environmental crash causation factors.

CrashType: This was a motorcycle (MC1) vs. other vehicle (OV1), non-contact crash event with a high side left lay down impact of the motorcycle on to the roadway surface. The motorcycle rider was ejected and sustained minor injuries as a result of impacting the roadway. There were no passengers on the motorcycle at the time of the crash.
MV1: 2013 Zero ZF 8.5 420 amp electric (conventional style) motorcycle, black
OV1: Unknown make possible Chevy Tahoe (sport utility vehicle), black
Crash:
This was a motorcycle vs. other vehicle non-contact crash event resulting in minor injuries to the motorcycle rider. The collision occurred on Tuesday,
December 2013 at 1435 hours in Southern California. The weather report showed	cloudy skies, a SW wind direction @ 5.8 mph, and an ambient temperature of +75.9 degrees F. The roadway surface was found to be dry, of an asphalt composition which appeared to be sharp, polished and in satisfactory condition.
There was a 0.2% uphill grade and 4.4% crown in the area of the crash site.
The collision occurred in the eastbound #1 lane of a straight four lane minor arterial roadway with and overall travel way width of 80 feet. The east and westbound lanes are divided by a 14 foot wide raised concrete median containing low lying surface vegetation and no median barrier or fence. There is an 8 foot wide bike lane along the north side of the roadway however the westbound side is an uninvolved portion of this crash event. The posted speed limit is 45 mph for both east and westbound traffic.
There is a four way signal controlled intersection east of the crash site with designated left and right turn lanes on the approach. The intersection was not part of the crash event.
