The roadway is bordered on both sides with concrete curbs and sidewalks in the area of the crash. On the right side, there is also a bus stop with a bus bench and shade structure in addition to the concrete sidewalk. The roadway is designated as a north/south roadway. In the area of the crash, the roadway has a left curve. The roadway is in a northeast/southwest orientation changing to a northwest/southeast orientation. MC1 was traveling through the curve and was northbound at 360 degrees when the crash took place. The length of curve was measured to be 472?. The radius was measured with a 100? chord and the mid-ordinate was 8?. The Radius of the curve is 1894?. The posted speed limit is 45 mph. The weather was cloudy/partly cloudy with no wind. The temperature was 71 degrees F. The crash occurred in September on a Monday at 0748 hrs. during hours of daylight in Southern California. There was no construction in the area of the crash. MC1 was towed. OV1 fled the scene without stopping.

MC1 was a 2005 Suzuki SV650S (645cc) sport/racing type motorcycle with minor modifications to the exhaust system.	The 56 year old male (5? 08?/150 lbs.) rider was wearing an adult small HJC Atomic CL-MAX 2 full face modular helmet that had a clear face shield. According to the rider, the helmet was damaged on the right side and face shield areas. Sections 11, 12, and 16 in the helmet form show the approximate areas of damage which consisted mostly of abrasions. The helmet was already disposed of by the rider and was not inspected. On the HJC web site, the helmet meets FMVSS 218 (US DOT) safety ratings. The rider was wearing an armored Kevlar motorcycle jacket that was mostly black but had yellow sleeves and waist, thin cotton brown pants, work type over the ankle brown boots, and full fingered leather gloves.
 
The rider was on his way to work from home. He stated that he was in the middle lane going approximately 50 mph. He said that there were no other vehicles near him other than OV1. The rider said that the driver of OV1 was in the left lane and driving slower than the flow of traffic, and then almost came to a stop. The rider stated that he was about to pass him in the #2 lane when suddenly OV1 made a lane change to the right, directly in front of him. The rider did not recall seeing any turn signal or brake lights activated on OV1. The rider stated that he only had time to grab the brakes and clutch lever in an attempt to stop, but that he still hit the back end of OV1 and went down. The rider stated that he believed that hit impacted OV1 in the middle of the rear end. The rider stated that OV1 was a gold colored vehicle and that he did not see the driver. After the crash, the driver of OV1 never stopped. OV1 was immediately fled the scene and was driven away in a northbound direction. In the police accident report, the POI is listed as being 35? west of the east curb line and 106? north of the north curb line. A single tire mark from what appears to be from the front tire of MC1 was located in this area which is in the #2 lane. The tire mark is approximately 18? long and veers slightly to the left. North of the tire mark some scrape marks were located. They start in the #2 lane and transcend across the lane line into the #1 lane to the FRP. The rider was fully ejected and skidded/slid to his FRP which was approximately 6? south of the FRP for MC1 in the #1 lane. In the on-scene photos, the headlights for MC1 were still on. After impact, MC1 skidded/slid forward high-side first.
RiderInj: The 56 year old male operator of MC1 sustained minor injuries consisting of a fractured C4 vertebra, one rib, several minor lacerations to his facial area, contused testicles, and ankles. The rider was taken to a local hospital where he was treated and released. The rider displayed no signs of intoxication or impairment that would inhibit his ability to operate a motor vehicle.
ODriverInj: The unknown operator of OV1 was not injured. The driver fled the scene without stopping. It is unknown if the driver had any impairment that would inhibit his/her ability to safely operate a motor vehicle.
Human: The operator of OV1 had a perception failure in not seeing MC1 approaching from the right rear.
Vehicle:
MC1 sustained moderate damage to the front and both sides. Most of the damage appears to be cosmetic in nature, consisting of a broken faring and right side foot peg. There are minor scratches on both sides of MC1. There was no reduction in wheelbase. The pre-crash condition of MC1 would be considered as very good.
OV1 was not inspected.
Environmental: There were no permanent or temporary environmental factors that would be considered contributory to this crash.
